description: A look at recent productions of Tennessee Williamss late works.

title: Picasso: Guitars 1912-1914
description: Images from the new exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Nixon, China and History
description: Photos of President Richard Nixons 1972 trip to China, and photos from the Mets new production of Nixon in China, the opera inspired by that visit.

title: Fashion Week Video | Kruse
description: In his latest high-impact video, Roper turns his lens on Christina Kruse, a 90s catwalk queen and a talented artist in her own right.

title: The Scene: Fashion Week Day 1
description: Scenes from Lincoln Center on the first day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Uncertainty Still Surrounds European Bank Candidate
description: FRANKFURT  Axel A. Weber, the president of the German central bank, would not discuss his plans on Thursday, leaving open the question of whether he remained a candidate to lead the European Central Bank.

title: An Arcade to Make Gamers Cry
description: On my first visit to Babycastles, an independent arcade in Queens, I watched as two young women explained to a friend the rules of a video game. It didnt involve fighting, special moves or guns, but it was full of big-headed cartoon characters wandering through a jewel-toned landscape.

title: Shooting Fashion, but Not Too Much of It
description: Ruth Fremson and Shayla Harris faced an obstacle Monday when they arrived at the workroom of the fashion designer Joseph Altuzarra in Lower Manhattan. The last thing Mr. Altuzarra wanted them to photograph was the very thing everyone wanted to see: his latest collection.

title: A Beep Too Soon
description: Our neighbors high school-aged son is picked up by a carpool every morning, promptly at 7:25. The driver signals her arrival with two sharp blasts of her car horn. It jolts me awake every day, and probably disturbs others on our block, too. Does this behavior seem as rude and as inconsiderate to you as it does to me? There must be some other way of letting the boy know his ride has arrived without startling everyone within earshot. May I speak with our neighbor, or will that make me seem difficult?

title: Protesters Anger Spills Over After Speech
description: CAIRO  Hours before the presidents speech, through dark, downtown streets, groups of young men and women stepped over the rocks of recent battles and walked toward the lights in Tahrir Square.

title: The Stars Realign. Do We?
description: THE tarot cards had long predicted that Matthew Foster was destined to fall in love with a Sagittarius. Then in 2009 he met Ben Mattson, a man he liked very much but who was a Capricorn.

title: Some Lessons in Renting Out a Second Home
description: Ive been renting out two homes in Litchfield County, Conn., since the early 2000s, and in all this time, I have just one horror story. But it is a doozy.

title: Citing Lawsuit Against Mets Owners, Moodys Reassesses Citi Fields Bonds
description: Although Citi Field is not a target of the lawsuit against the Mets owners by the trustee for the victims of Bernard L. Madoffs fraud, the bonds that financed it have a new black mark against them.

title: Walgreens Launches Campaign to Push Store-Brand Products
description: THE next time consumers visit a Walgreens drugstore looking for something to soothe their achy heads, the company hopes they will reach for its private-label pain reliever and not a brand name.

title: Under Tucsons Shadow, Democrats To Search for Senate Candidate
description: The situation in Arizona, where Republican Senator Jon Kyl announced Thursday his intentions to retire, is a little trickier to sort out than some of the other cases that weve looked at recently. So lets start with the basics: what is the overall partisan orientation of the state?

title: SUNY Leaders Argue for Regular, Modest Tuition Rises
description: ALBANY  In his budget last week, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo proposed sharp cuts in state financing for public colleges and universities. But in a nod to the difficult financial circumstances many New Yorkers face, Mr. Cuomo did not seek to raise tuition to offset his cuts.

title: Covenant-Lite Loans Prove Less Risky Than Thought
description: Loans with fewer restrictions on them may not be so dangerous after all. So says Tony James, president of the Blackstone Group, the private equity firm. And the numbers suggest he could be partly right. So-called covenant-lite loans are borrower-friendly but have been considered risky for lenders. As it turns out, they perform no worse, or a bit better, than debt with covenants.

title: GPS on a Path to the Heart
description: IS there a proven strategy for finding love? If so, I suspect millions of people would like to know. In six years of editing this column, I have received so many stories from the baffled and the frustrated that even tsunami metaphors cant convey the volume.

title: Iran Presses Opposition to Refrain From Rally
description: TEHRAN  Irans authorities have increased pressure on the countrys political opposition days before a rally proposed by opposition leaders in support of the popular uprisings in Tunisia and Egypt.

title: In Montana, A Bid to End Medical Use Of Marijuana
description: HELENA, Mont.  The Montana House of Representatives voted Thursday to repeal the states six-year-old medical marijuana law.

title: Breast-Feeding Supplies Win Tax Breaks From I.R.S.
description: Ending a long-running dispute with pediatricians and breast-feeding advocates, the Internal Revenue Service announced Thursday that it would grant nursing mothers a tax break on pumps and other breastfeeding supplies.

title: Canada Womens Soccer Players Back Coach, Planning Boycott
description: Canadas preparations for this summers Womens World Cup in Germany were thrown into disarray this week when the resignation of the national team coach led her players to announce plans to boycott any international matches unless officials succeed in getting her to change her mind.

title: Philadelphia Priests Accused by Grand Jury of Sexual Abuse and Cover-Up
description: PHILADELPHIA  A grand jury on Thursday accused the Archdiocese of Philadelphia of failing to stop the sexual abuse of children more than five years after a grand jury report documented abuse by more than 50 priests.

title: U.S. Proposes New Forest Management Plan
description: The federal Department of Agriculture unveiled a new plan on Thursday to manage the national forest system that government officials said would give them more flexibility in responding to modern stresses like climate change while also heading off lawsuits.

title: Behind a Push for Parole in Chicago, a Prisoners Old Neighborhood
description: CHICAGO  At a cafe in the heart of this citys exuberant Puerto Rican community, in the neighborhood of Humboldt Park, a waitress serves up favorites from the island: caf con leche, rice and beans and guava pastries. On the counter, a framed photograph of a white-haired man sits next to a stack of petitions calling for his release from prison.

title: Military Caught Between Mubarak and Protesters
description: WASHINGTON  Even as prodemocracy demonstrations in Cairo riveted the worlds attention for 17 days, the Egyptian military managed the crisis with seeming finesse, winning over street protesters, quietly consolidating its domination of top government posts and sidelining potential rivals for leadership, notably President Hosni Mubaraks son, Gamal.

title: Emory Bellard, Creator of Wishbone Offense, Dies at 83
description: Emory Bellard, the coach who was credited with introducing the wishbone formation to college football, providing the framework for many of the great running teams of the 1970s, died Thursday in Georgetown, Tex. He was 83.

title: Mario Cuomo to Mediate Dispute in Wilpon-Madoff Case
description: Mario M. Cuomo, the former New York governor, will serve as a mediator in the standoff between the trustee for the victims of the Bernard L. Madoffs Ponzi scheme and Fred Wilpon, Saul Katz and Sterling Equities, who are accused of profiting from Mr. Madoffs actions, The New York Times reports.

title: 50 Feet Below Midtown, Injured Worker Is Rescued
description: The injured payload operator was unable to move and lying in the dirt and water of a cavernous construction area 50 feet below the streets of Midtown Manhattan  a dark, cold ditch far from the firefighters grasp.

title: A Kitsch-and-Tell Movie of Garden Variety Love
description: Instead of toys, lawn ornaments: ceramic garden gnomes, to be precise. In the 3-D animated Gnomeo and Juliet, as in the Toy Story movies, these kitschy items twitch to life only when the humans arent looking, which seems to be most of the time.

title: Arizona: State Countersues Over Immigration Law
description: Gov. Jan Brewer of Arizona said Thursday that she will raise private funds to countersue the federal government for failing to enforce immigration laws. The claim was filed in the Justice Departments challenge to Arizonas immigration law, parts of which have been struck down by a federal judge. At a news conference, Ms. Brewer and Attorney General Tom Horne said the Obama administration had failed to prevent illegal immigrants from crossing the border in huge numbers and stuck the state with the cost of dealing with its failed policies. Arizona officials dispute statistics showing that crime along the border is down significantly. In their legal challenge, the state intends to argue that it is being invaded by illegal immigrants from Mexico. A spokesman for the Department of Homeland Security, Matt Chander said in a statement in response, A meritless claim such as this does nothing to secure the border.

title: For Ex-Hostage, Lawsuit Against Iran Is Unfinished Business
description: Barry Rosens fascination with Iran began in 1967, when he went there from his native Brooklyn for a two-year adventure as a Peace Corps volunteer. He taught English and he learned Farsi, the Persian spoken by Iranians. Iran became, in many ways, a second home for me, he said the other day.

title: Boxer Secures Citizenship in Olympic Quest
description: Erick De Leon, a 19-year-old boxing champion living in Detroit but born in Mexico, had said that if he obtained his United States citizenship, winning the gold medal in the 2012 Olympics could be a piece of cake, or pan comido in Spanish. Now, it looks as if De Leon will at least get his opportunity to fight for it.

title: J. D. Salingers Love and Squalor
description: J. D. Salinger spent the first third of his life trying to get noticed and the rest of it trying to disappear. He would have hated J. D. Salinger: A Life, Kenneth Slawenskis reverent new biography, which comes to us just a year after the writers death and creditably unearths and aggregates the facts and reads them into the fiction  reanimating the corpse without quite making it sing.

title: Trafficking Investigations Put Surgeon in Spotlight
description: ISTANBUL  For a surgeon wanted by Interpol and suspected of harvesting human organs for an international black-market trafficking ring, Dr. Yusuf Sonmez was remarkably relaxed as he sipped Turkish red wine in a bustling kebab restaurant facing the wind-whipped Sea of Marmara.

title: The Road to True Love Is Paved With a Whole Lot of Lying
description: I should start by confessing that I spent a lot of time before the screening of Just Go With It  and a few stretches while it was actually going on  trying to remember what the darn thing was called. I may have to look up the title a few more times before this review is done, and the movie is likely to live on in my memory (to the extent that it will) as that one with Adam Sandler and Jennifer Aniston in Hawaii. Which pretty much sums up both the appeal and the limitations of this passive-aggressive, naughty but nice, sometimes obnoxious and occasionally quite funny late-winter romantic comedy.

title: Wayne Lees Renaissance
description: Over just a few seasons, Wayne Lee, one of the rising stars of the young designer scene, has pretty much changed her entire look. Shes gone from a designer of trendy contemporary clothes with just a hint of edge to someone who fully embraces a tougher street look. Her collections, now more grown up, make a statement of strength.

title: TimesCast | February 10, 2011
description: David Kirkpatrick assesses what Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak's refusal to step down means for the thousands of protesters in the streets.

title: A Somber Show at Christian Siriano
description: All right, Ill admit it. I liked the Christian Siriano show. And Im not the only one.

title: Web Words That Lure the Readers
description: The Huffington Post has hired veteran journalists to beef up its news coverage. But a significant chunk of its readers come instead for articles like one published this week: Chelsy Davy & Prince Harry: So Happy Together?

title: President Obamas Statement on Egypt
description: President Barack Obama issued this statement on Thursday in response to developments in Egypt:

title: For Republicans, Too, a Broad Power Shift After the Elections
description: WASHINGTON  Three months have passed since the Congressional elections upended the balance of power in Washington, yet the Tea Party wave continues to ripple across all facets of politics. The best example, perhaps, is the Republican Party itself.

title: Privately, Public Employees See Cuts as Inevitable
description: UNION, N.J.  The meeting of the public-workers union had ended, the rallying cries about hostile lawmakers and ominous contract deadlines had given way to a buffet dinner.

title: The Next Step for Egypts Opposition
description: Cairo

title: 60s Snipper Extraordinaire
description: Vidal Sassoon: The Movie opens with a blast of hyperbole from an assembly of disembodied voices: I think its impossible to overestimate the importance of Vidal Sassoon. He built something that rocked the world. He was one of the greatest if not the greatest hairdresser who ever lived. One commentator even compares Mr. Sassoon, now a spry, fit 83, to Einstein and Muhammad Ali.

title: Obama Faces a Stark Choice on Mubarak
description: WASHINGTON  President Hosni Mubaraks refusal to step down on Thursday, after a day of rumors galvanized the crowds in Cairo, confronts the Obama administration with a stark choice: break decisively with Mr. Mubarak or stick to its call for an orderly transition that may no longer be tenable.

title: Crime Down, Bills Up: How Snow Affects the City
description: With no snow for days, and none in the immediate forecast, the city is moving out of its period of being buried, which began the day after Christmas and never seemed to end. But as the snow melts, and as city officials tally the cost of this record-breaking winter, other price tags are becoming clear  whether they be financial, emotional, even electrical.

title: Ex-C.I.A. Agent Goes Public With Story of Mistreatment on the Job
description: WASHINGTON  In many ways, the personal injury lawsuit looked routine: In late 2001, a government employee and his family sued the agency he worked for, saying it had placed them in a mold-contaminated home that made them sick and required nearly all their possessions to be destroyed.

title: Out of Touch, Out of Time
description: CAIRO

title: Lebanese Bank Is Accused of Money Laundering
description: WASHINGTON  The United States accused one of Lebanons largest banks on Thursday of laundering hundreds of millions of dollars a month for a multinational drug trafficking organization with ties to Hezbollah.

title: City Taxi Commissioner Says He Is Seeking Changes to TV Service in Cabs
description: Cant stand Taxi TV? Even New Yorks taxi commissioner feels your pain.

title: The Freedom Alliance
description: Over the past few weeks, Ive had a chance to interview some amazing people. I sat down with Bill Gates, who was in Washington to try to keep the looming budget cuts from decimating the foreign aid programs.

title: Murder Trial in Tucson Shows Rift in Minuteman Border Movement
description: TUCSON  In the weeks since Tucson buried Christina-Taylor Green, the 9-year-old victim of the shooting rampage outside a Safeway supermarket, a trial under way in the county courthouse here has struggled to account for the earlier murder of yet another child of the same age.

title: Lottery Numbers
Europes Foreign Policy Chief, Struggling for Mandate, Faces Criticism on Uprisings
description: PARIS  After President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt refused to step down on Thursday night, infuriating demonstrators in his country, the European Unions foreign policy chief, Catherine Ashton, issued a sharp statement saying that the time for change is now and that Mr. Mubarak has not yet opened the way to faster and deeper reforms.

title: Abraham Lincoln, Inflationist
description: There was a time when Republicans used to refer to themselves, proudly, as the party of Lincoln. But you dont hear that line much these days. Why?

title: Crooked Lawyers and Broken People
description: Set in a featureless corner of Buenos Aires called La Matanza, Carancho dives into a nocturnal world of crooked lawyers and broken people.

title: Assisting Suicide to Be Focus of Trial in Motivational Speakers Death
description: The man in the black car was approaching people on an East Harlem street corner, asking to buy a gun and saying he wanted to do a Kevorkian. Kenneth Minor said he shooed the man away, but he returned with a more outrageous request:

title: Beyond Reason on the Budget
description: After two years of raging at President Obamas spending plans, House Republican leaders have finally revealed their real vision of small government: tens of billions in ideologically driven cuts to job training, environmental protection, disease control, crime protection and dozens of other critical functions that only the government can perform.

title: Justice Scalias Misstep
description: To the Editor:

title: South Africa: President Announces New Spending on Jobs
description: President Jacob Zuma made tackling staggering unemployment the governments top priority on Thursday. He announced $2.7 billion in tax breaks to encourage investment in manufacturing, and an additional $1.25 billion for job-creation undertakings, without offering specifics. The unemployment rate fell to 24 percent from 25.3 percent in the final quarter of 2010. When those who have given up looking for work are included, more than a third of the potential work force is jobless.

title: Kicking Our Fossil Fuels Habit
description: About 65 minutes into Carbon Nation, a peppy documentary about all sorts of technologies that might help us kick our fossil fuels habit, the film acknowledges its biggest shortcoming.

title: S.E.C.s Budget Problems
description: To the Editor:

title: Cameras in the Delivery Room
description: To the Editor:

title: After a Retreat From Limelight, a Death, and Rekindled Anger
description: ST. LOUIS  There was a time when August Busch IV would enter bars here and approach total strangers, the ones bold enough to sip on a Coors or Miller in public. He would ask if he could buy them a Budweiser, usually politely but sometimes adding enough of a jostle to knock over the offending beverage.

title: Jonathan Winters in the Spotlight
description: Certifiably Jonathan, a self-described mockumentary constructed around the 85-year-old comic genius and artist Jonathan Winters, is teeming with smart American humorists  and a passel of Arquettes  all unconditionally admiring. Whats astonishing, then, is that not one of them stepped in to dissuade their friend from participating in such an embarrassingly awful project.

title: A Fork in Road to the White House
description: WASHINGTON  If you just cant get enough of C-Spans daytime programming and are inclined to watch all of the speechifying at the annual gathering of conservative activists here this week, then keep in mind that these potential Republican presidential candidates face a choice in the earliest months of this nascent campaign.

title: Farewell to Springfield
Friday: Paparazzi Targets
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  When ballplayers hit for the cycle, it means they have hit a single, a double, a triple and a home run in a single game, although they dont have to be in that order. The last professional player to have performed such a feat is Carlos Gonzalez of the Colorado Rockies on July 31, 2010. Congratulations. You have now witnessed the complete range of my knowledge of sports. Thanks, MLB.com!

title: When the Final Curtain Doesnt Fall
description: Human life is measured in inhuman ways in When I Come to Die, a sober, meticulously wrought drama by Nathan Louis Jackson set on death row in an Indiana prison. The coming of dawn brings no birdsong, or even the comforting blare of city horns. Time is measured by the clanging of cell doors and the mechanical blinking on and off of fluorescent lights. Each day brings the same cold routine, the same blank night.

title: If You Go to the Show, You May Just Land a Role
description: Time to face it. You are probably not going to be making an appearance on The Oprah Winfrey Show. The waning days of that celebrated syndicated chatfest are upon us, and if you have not yet received the call, it is unlikely that you will be joining Ms. Winfrey on the plush couches under the comforting lighting to discuss your memoir of a miserable childhood, your new aromatherapy line or your discovery that sex just gets better in middle age.

title: Judge Fogel and the Death Penalty
description: On Tuesday, Judge Jeremy Fogel of the Federal District Court in northern California toured a new facility at San Quentin State Prison for executing inmates. Five years ago, in Morales v. Tilton, he ordered the state to halt all executions after he found that the way it administered its lethal injection created too much risk that an inmate would suffer extreme pain.

title: N.B.A. Dean of Coaches Resigns Abruptly
description: Jerry Sloan and Larry H. Miller, the late owner of the Utah Jazz, had a gentlemans agreement a few years ago. Sloan would agree to a one-year contract every winter, mull it over in the spring and officially commit in the summer. The process was as certain as the changing of the seasons.

title: Protecting the Whistle-Blowers
description: All those Capitol budget hawks searching out waste, fraud and abuse should first find out why some mystery lawmaker killed a long-needed whistle-blower protection bill in the final hours of the last Congress.

title: U.S. Indicts 31 in Crackdown on Newburgh Gangs
description: WHITE PLAINS  Continuing its offensive on the violent gangs that have run roughshod over Newburgh, federal authorities on Thursday unsealed a new indictment against reputed members and associates of the Latin Kings on charges that included murder, assault and racketeering.

title: Marriage Equality in New York
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomos pledge to make a strong push in the next few months to pass legislation legalizing same-sex marriage in New York State is a promising development. Speaking on Wednesday at Hofstra University, Governor Cuomo said he intends to ask the Legislature to take up the measure and that he will be working very hard to pass it.

title: Fraternal Rivalry and Failed Ambition
description: The bond between two brothers becomes irretrievably twisted in Lovers of Hate, an unusually perceptive examination of fraternal rivalry and failed ambition.

title: Yeshiva Fair Is a Bastion for Jewish Books of the Printed Variety
description: Those who mourn the metamorphosis of books made of paper into digital versions for e-readers can find some solace by taking a trip to Washington Heights in Manhattan.

title: Mubaraks Feb. 10, 2011, Speech
description: Interactive video and transcript of the speech given by President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt.

title: New-Look St. Johns Continues to Make Garden Its Own
description: From its rafter-rattling victory over Georgetown earlier this season to its upset of Duke the last time it played at Madison Square Garden, St. Johns has brought the kind of vitality to the arena that was missing for nearly a decade when the Red Storm took the court.

title: The Link Between Female Sexuality and Corporate Profits
description: What does an orgasm mean to you? the filmmaker Liz Canner asks of several women who appear in Orgasm Inc. The answers vary, but Ms. Canner is more interested in what orgasm means to the pharmaceutical industry. And by taking a playful approach to a deeply serious subject, she explores the link between female sexuality and corporate profits with a style thats as entertaining as it is revelatory.

title: Photo Replay: Feb. 10
description: Skiing in Germany, solace on a lake in a kayak, and more from the day in sports.

title: Mexico: Kidnap Sentence Upheld; France Warns of Consequences
description: A Frenchwoman serving a 60-year sentence in Mexico for kidnapping lost her final appeal on Thursday, drawing a blistering response from France. The woman, Florence Cassez, left, has said she knew nothing about the kidnappings, which her boyfriend has confessed to. On appeal, she argued that the authorities violated several procedures, including staging her arrest for television. The court ruled that that had no impact on her conviction. In a statement, the French foreign minister, Michle Alliot-Marie, said justice had been denied, warning, This decision will weigh on our bilateral relations.

title: Return to a Spanish Village
description: In 2003 Mercedes lvarez returned, with a video camera, to the village of her birth in a rocky, empty region of northern Spain. No one had been born there since she was, and now fewer than 20 people remained, one of whom died during the year she spent recording their lives for her documentary The Sky Turns.

title: Dominican Trainer Accused of Sexual Abuse
description: A trainer of teenage baseball prospects in the Dominican Republic has been accused by two of his former players of sexually abusing them, adding to a list of recent scandals in the procurement of Latin American talent by Major League Baseball teams.

title: China: Rights Group Says Couple Beaten for Making Video
description: A human rights advocacy group based in the United States, China Aid Association, said Thursday that a human rights lawyer and his wife were severely beaten by security forces for having recorded a video revealing the details of the lawyers detention. The video of the blind Chinese rights lawyer, Chen Guangcheng, who has been under house arrest since he was released from prison last September, was posted by the rights organization on Wednesday. According to the video, 22 people have been assigned to watch Mr. Chens home in Shandong Province around the clock, he is not allowed to leave, cellphone calls cannot be made from the home and security officials bar any visitors. The organization said that Mr. Chen and his wife were beaten so severely they were not able to move from their bed, and they were denied the right to go to the hospital for medical care. Mr. Chen was sent to prison in 2006 for his human rights advocacy, and in particular for pointing out forced sterilizations and abortions in official abuses of Chinas one-child policy.

title: Gulf Coast Wind Farms Spring Up, as Do Worries
description: SARITA  On the 400,000-acre Kenedy Ranch along the southern Gulf Coast, the wind coming off the water nearly flattops the clusters of oak trees. Towering above the trees, above the long grasses, sand dunes, grazing cattle and the occasional antelope, are scores of wind turbines, each about as tall as a football field is long.

title: Symbolism, Not Savings, Is at Heart of Perry Budget
description: Ross Ramsey, the managing editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column.

title: China: Rain, Snow and Artillery Said to Ease Drought
description: Chinese drought control officials announced late Thursday that they had reduced their estimate of drought-affected land in Chinas wheat belt by about a tenth after rain and snow fell in parts of northern China on Wednesday and Thursday, according to state media. The government used artillery to seed clouds, and has begun emergency irrigation efforts. Premier Wen Jiabao sought to reassure the public in televised remarks on Thursday that the supply and demand of grain were basically in balance, and that the government had stockpiles and would not let inflation rise sharply.

title: Community Colleges Are Uneasy as Ax Hangs Over State Aid for Health Benefits
description: The Legislatures initial state budget proposals calling for the closing of four community colleges caught many lawmakers off guard. But what largely escaped their attention  the slashing of health benefits across all such institutions  is what concerns community college officials the most.

title: France: Courts Slow in Protest
description: Courthouses across France heard only urgent cases on Thursday as thousands of magistrates and police officers demonstrated after President Nicolas Sarkozy criticized the justice systems handling of a grisly murder case. Last week, Mr. Sarkozy denounced the early release from prison of the primary suspect in the killing of an 18-year-old waitress. While the magistrates agree that the system had failed, they said it had stemmed from a lack of resources.

title: The Mubarak Muddle
description: CAIRO

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for

title: Mali: Details Sought on Land Deals
description: An opposition party has written an open letter to the government demanding that it account for hundreds of thousands of acres being leased to private investors and foreign governments. The government has said it needs foreign investors because it cannot afford the cost of developing its vast bushlands into productive farmland. The letter from the Party for National Renaissance questioned whether the government was giving the land away to countries including Libya, China and Brazil without ensuring that food sufficiency was the priority. It demanded that the government release the financial details of the leases, as well as the required environmental impact studies.

title: Maybe the Deficit Needs to Get More Personal
description: James Warren is a columnist for the Chicago News Cooperative.

title: Driving Thrills or Thrilling Mileage: You Decide
description: The sweet smell of daffodils was in the air at McCormick Place on Wednesday as hybrid-electric Chevrolet Volts glided silently along a test track.

title: Chef Hopes Miracle Berry Becomes the Sweet Taste of the City and Worlds Beyond
description: The tiny, red West African fruit known as the miracle berry, which tricks the tongue into perceiving sour tastes as sweet, has become the rage in recent years. Flavor-trippers nibble on the fruit, then sip Tabasco sauce or bite into lemons for a little added fun.

title: Chibots Prepare for Debut in Heddatron
description: An hour before the start of Tuesday nights penultimate dress rehearsal, half the cast of Sideshow Theatre Companys Heddatron was making a lot of noise  lunging and stretching, their voices swooping through a range of warm-up exercises. Downstage, the cast members Billy-bot and Hans stood apart, occasionally flexing an arm or a neck joint, winking at curious onlookers and, when provoked, beeping loudly.

title: Singapore and the U.N.
description: To the Editor:

title: Data Confirm What Cyclists Knew: San Francisco Streets Are Hazardous
description: One September morning last year, Mary Jenn, a San Francisco massage therapist, was riding her bike to work when a police officer who was parked on OFarrell Street opened the door of his cruiser in her path.

title: After the Storms of January, Civility Settles Over City Hall
description: Late last month, the San Francisco Board of Supervisors considered the nomination of Richard Johns, a lawyer, for the Historic Preservation Committee.

title: Knicks DAntoni Counts Differences With Lakers
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  When Coach Mike DAntoni considered the Lakers, he noted that their roster had stars worthy of playing in Los Angeles. How far do his Knicks have to go to reach that level? Let him count the ways.

title: Lost for Years, a Trove of Chinatown Art Is Tracked Down
description: Its a modern detective story, set in San Franciscos atmospheric Chinatown.

title: When the Dog Isnt Yours, but the Fine for Its Waste Is
description: Scott James is a columnist for The Bay Citizen.

title: Corrections
description: EDITOR'S NOTE

title: Holding Flowers and Gun, Queens Man Kills His Ex-Wife and, Later, Himself
description: An armed man holding a bouquet of flowers walked into a Queens pharmacy on Thursday and shot and killed his ex-wife  who had an order of protection against him  and then went home and killed himself, the authorities said.

title: Bloggingheads: Crime and Poverty
description: Vesla Weaver, left, of the University of Virginia and Heather Mac Donald of the Manhattan Institute debate the relationship between crime and poverty.

title: Prosecutors Reduce Charges Against Bonds
description: Federal prosecutors reduced on Thursday the number of perjury charges against Barry Bonds, cutting the overall charges against him to 5 from 11.

title: For Celtics Allen, a Moment to Cherish; for the Lakers, a Victory to Savor
description: BOSTON  On a night that was otherwise framed by rivalries and rough edges, Ray Allen was all hugs and heartfelt emotion.

title: Mayor of Rust
description: At the Aspen Ideas Festival in Colorado last July, John Fetterman, the mayor of Braddock, a small Pennsylvania town 10 miles upriver from Pittsburgh, was introduced by Dana Gioia, former chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts, as a man who demonstrates how ideas can change the world. It was four days into the weeklong festival, and Fetterman, a 41-year-old, 6-foot-8 white man with a shaved head, a fibrous black beard and tattoos up one arm and down the other, was presenting a slideshow about how art could bring social change to a town where one-third of its 2,671 residents, a majority of whom are African-American and female, live in poverty. Fetterman projected pictures of old, bustling Braddock, which steel made until the middle of the 20th century and unmade throughout the rest. Its main street was packed with shoppers, its storefronts filled with wares. Then he turned to Braddock as it is today.

title: Word of the Day | sleazy
description: sleazy \sle-ze also sla-\ adjective

title: No Moby-Dick: A Real Captain, Twice Doomed
description: HONOLULU  In the annals of the sea, there were few sailors whose luck was worse than George Pollard Jr.s.

title: UConn Quarterback Has Plenty of Tricks
description: With the Bowl Championship Series title game a distant memory, college football fans may be forgiven for thinking it will be a tough few months before their favorite teams take the field again. Take heart! Watching Connecticut quarterback Johnny McEntee and his array of tricks is the perfect way to pass the time before next season kicks off.

title: Timeline: A Day of Whiplash
description: A look at some of the events Thursday, when hopes rose among protesters that President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt would step down, but were met with disappointment.

title: Perry, Sculptor of Geometric Forms, Dies
description: Charles O. Perry, a sculptor who created dozens of mathematically inspired works for plazas and sculpture gardens throughout the United States and abroad, died in Norwalk, Conn.

title: Egypt Erupts in Jubilation as Mubarak Steps Down
description: CAIRO  An 18-day-old revolt led by the young people of Egypt ousted President Hosni Mubarak on Friday, shattering three decades of political stasis here and overturning the established order of the Arab world.

title: Seizure Highlights Illegal Wildlife Trading
description: This week the authorities at Bangkoks international airport intercepted a would-be wildlife smuggler, an Indonesian man whose three suitcases contained dozens of turtles and tortoises, 44 snakes, including pythons and two boa constrictors, assorted lizards and spiders  oh, and a parrot.

title: Peggy Rea, TV Actress With Matronly Aura, Dies at 89
description: Peggy Rea, a matronly actress who had supporting roles on popular television series from the 1970s to the 90s, died on Saturday at her home in Toluca Lake, Calif. She was 89.

title: Charles O. Perry Dies at 81; Sculptor Inspired by Geometry
description: Charles O. Perry, a sculptor who created dozens of mathematically inspired works for plazas and sculpture gardens throughout the United States and abroad and created Continuum, the knotted black Mbius strip that stands in front of the Smithsonians National Air and Space Museum in Washington, died on Tuesday at his home in Norwalk, Conn. He was 81.

title: News Quiz | February 11, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Pakistan Extends Jailing of American Held in 2 Deaths
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  A Pakistani court on Friday ordered an American official, arrested in the killing of two Pakistanis, to be held for another two weeks while the authorities prepared charges in what the police called a coldblooded murder.

title: Morning T | Alan Cumming
description: In this installment of our video interview series, Horacio Silva sits down with Alan Cumming, who is currently starring as Eli Gold in CBSs The Good Wife. Among the topics discussed: Cummings new fragrance, red carpet fashion, and rocking a man-frock at fashion shows.

title: Daily Lexeme: Exitial
description: Todays word, in association with the treasured Oxford English Dictionary, is

title: What Music Are You Listening To?
description: The Grammy Awards will be given this Sunday, and Eminem leads the nominations, though Jay-Z, Lady Gaga, Lady Antebellum and Bruno Mars also racked up plenty of nods. Meanwhile, Nicky Minaj is at the top of the Billboard chart. What, or whom, are you listening to these days? Whom do you think most deserves a music award this year, even if that artist or group wasnt nominated for a Grammy?

title: Test Yourself | History, Feb. 11, 2011
description: Test your knowledge of history with todays question about a major event in world history.

title: In London, a Festival Just for the Kids
description: Kids rule at the Imagine Childrens Festival, which takes place Feb. 12 to 27 at the Southbank Center. Established 10 years ago to celebrate childrens literature, it now encompasses a variety of activities for youngsters aged 5 to 11, plus a few for the (even more) junior set.

title: Ray Lucas Writes About Painkiller Detox on Facebook
description: If it wasnt for the Cuban, I would have jumped off this bridge a long time ago, Lucas moans as he points to his wife, Cecy, the slim, pretty Cuban-American woman sitting in the middle row of the SUV. If it werent for her and the kids, I might have killed myself or somebody else by now.Ray Lucas, in an article by Michael OKeeffe of The Daily News in September

title: Does Higher Pay Make People More Loyal?
description: Last spring I exchanged e-mails with Amy Christensen-Waddell, president of Albion Swords, which makes reproduction swords and armor (and I thought my business was niche!). Discussing employee pay, she asked: If your people are making a lot of money, do you find it makes them more loyal? I didnt give her an immediate answer, but the question has been in the back of my mind since then. Heres my current thinking:

title: Hong Kong Developer to Raise $1.3 Billion
description: Wharf Holdings, the Hong Kong-based real estate developer, said Thursday that it would seek to raise 10.1 billion Hong Kong dollars, or $1.3 billion, in a rights issue.

title: Nord Gold Postpones Public Offering
description: Nord Gold, the gold division of the Russian miner Severstal, said Friday that it was postponing its initial public offering on the London Stock Exchange, with which it had hoped to raise up to $1.3 billion.

title: As Gibbs Leaves White House, a Look at His Tenure
description: As President Obama and his top advisers were debating whether to call for a ban on congressional earmarks last month, Robert Gibbs, the presidents chief spokesman, offered what one person in the room called a passionate plea on behalf of the idea.

title: Complaint Box | Not Enough Men to Go Around
description: I was in the cafe at Borders last month when a homeless man asked to sit next to me. He cast several glances my way before offering me two sandwiches from his plastic Conway bag. If I hadnt already had dinner plans, I might have taken him up on his tuna fish.

title: Is This the Best News Picture in the World?
description: At the very first glimpse  perhaps seen as a thumbnail image on a computer screen  it looks like a perfectly conventional studio portrait of a lovely young woman. A second glance provides the shock. Bibi Aisha, 18 years old, has been dreadfully disfigured.

title: Earnings Jumps 28% at DBS of Singapore
description: DBS Group, the largest bank in southeast Asia, said Friday that net profit for last year rose 28 percent to 2.65 billion Singapore dollars, or $2 billion, amid loan growth, bond sales, and a recovery in asset values.

Union Market to Open in Manhattan
description: Union Market, which first opened in Park Slope, Brooklyn, on Union Street in 2004, plans a 6,000-square-foot market at 240 East Houston Street (Avenue A) in the fall, its first in Manhattan, and the largest of the four stores.

title: Indian Farmers Left Behind
description: Rising food prices in India reflect a stark challenge for India:  Even as the country modernizes and its economy grows, farmers still lack the technology to produce enough food.

title: Morning Buzz | The Broad Effects of a Harsh Winter
description: Today is brought to you by cold, clear, crisp and other c-words. High 35. A bit warmer tomorrow.

description: No sooner had the ESPN analyst Trent Dilfer gushed over a phenomenal workout by the Auburn star Cam Newton on Thursday than the backlash began.

description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administrations much-anticipated report on redesigning the governments role in housing finance, published Friday, is not solely a proposal to dissolve the unpopular finance companies Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

title: Alice Makes Its Technical Push
description: LOS ANGELES Most casual Oscar observers cant be bothered with the hinterland categories  art direction, sound mixing and the like. A lot of voters similarly ignore the nuances of those races, which is one reason Sony Pictures Imageworks has been pedaling its little legs off on behalf of Alice in Wonderland.

title: Galloping Growth, and Hunger in India
description: BAMNOD, India  The 50-year-old farmer knew from experience that his onion crop was doomed when torrential rains pounded his fields throughout September, a month when the Indian monsoon normally peters out.

title: Hedge Fund Urges Higher Bid for Danisco
description: 10:31 a.m. | Updated Elliott Associates is back on the war path. The $17 billion hedge fund, which last week assailed the board of the Swiss pharmaceutical Actelion for a lack of transparency, has fired off another letter, this time to Danisco.

title: New York Fashion Week Tweets | Friday
description: Today from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m., we will be going backstage at Jason Wu, to give you a behind-the-scenes look at the busiest and most exhilarating moments before the show.

title: Bilbo Baggins and the 13 Dwarves: Meet the Cast of The Hobbit
description: After months of uncertainty, the near financial collapse of a movie studio, a change in directors and a heated labor dispute, the cast of Peter Jacksons two-film adaptation of The Hobbit was at last introduced to the news media on Friday at a press conference in New Zealand.

title: Area Illusion
description: Im a big fan of Gillian Tetts work, but  such statements always come with a but, right?  in todays piece she falls prey to a map trick. She looks at the divergence in unemployment rates among US states, and suggests that America is experiencing European-style divergence:

title: Treasury Department Wants to Wind Down Fannie, Freddie
description: The Treasury Departments long-awaited report on the future of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac recommends that the Obama administration wind down the government-controlled mortgage finance companies.

title: Hurdle Is Cleared for $1.2 Billion Q-Med Deal
description: Galderma, the joint venture between LOreal and Nestl, said Friday that its bid for the Swedish company Q-Med had received the necessary approvals from regulators, making its offer no longer conditional upon receipt of clearances.

title: Dynegy Pleads With Shareholders to Take Icahn Deal
description: The Dynegy board committee supervising the energy companys sale process issued a letter to shareholders on Friday, urging them to accept a $665 million takeover offer by Carl C. Icahn.

title: Fashion Week Video | Kruse
description: Barnaby Roper doesnt do things by half. But he is not against the idea of using a 16-part grid. In his latest high-impact video, Kruse, created exclusively for The Moment, Roper turns his lens on Christina Kruse, a 90s catwalk queen and a talented artist in her own right. Kruses image is carved up into a digital chopping block that twists and turns and squeezes her through a series of kaleidoscopic formations. Look out for more videos from Roper as the year progresses  assuming the technology can keep up.

title: First-Time Queens Double Demands
description: DESPITE some recent requests for tickets there will be no performance of Black Swan at the David H. Koch Theater any time soon. That Oscar-nominated film has garnered so much attention that some potential audience members seem to think its an actual ballet. It isnt, of course, but in a bit of interesting timing New York City Ballet is now presenting its version of the actual work the film bears some resemblance to, Swan Lake.

title: A Tabloid Star Is Joining the Sisterhood of the Fallen
description: LONDON

title: Dont Cut You, Dont Cut Me
description: Cut the fellow behind the tree thats overseas. Pew on public fiscal views isnt really all that surprising, but its still striking: people want spending cut, but are opposed to cuts in anything except foreign aid:

title: Mazda 5 Is Ready for Parenthood, Diapers Not Included
description: I USED to make minivan jokes. They were harmless jabs  reflexive, and lets face it, clichd  at friends about their pending parenthood.

title: Tip of the Week: Sending Deep Links From YouTube
description: Want to share just the good part of a long YouTube video with a friend and spare your pal from having to sit through the boring stuff at the beginning? Thanks to YouTubes Deep Links feature, you can e-mail a URL that takes the recipient directly to a specific time within the video.

title: Table Disservice
description: No Kindles in cafes? Youve got to be kidding. This is an affront, not only to readers and gadget lovers, but also to the spirit of cafes!

title: The Husbands Speech
description: When I crossed the threshold into my husbands hospital room, I entered a world that was unfamiliar, with an unfamiliar man lying in it. He suffered a massive stroke only days before, one tailor-made to his own private hell. In the cruelest of twists for a novelist-professor obsessed with words, the stroke ravaged the language areas of his brain.

title: Shareholder Suit Aims to Stop Ensco-Pride Deal
description: A Pride International shareholder has filed a class action lawsuit against the Houston-based company, hoping to halt its planned merger with Ensco, a rival offshore oil drilling contractor.

title: 2012 Mazda 5
description: The new Mazda 5s size offers a compromise for skeptical minivan buyers.

title: Investors Are Encouraged by a Change in Egypt
description: Stocks rose for a second week as Hosni Mubaraks resignation in Egypt and a jump in American consumers confidence bolstered optimism in the global economic recovery.

description: Full EAF Supreme Council Statement: The Supreme Council of the Egyptian Armed Forces issued its second statement today Friday. It says the following:

description: Dear Everyone,

description: The following is an unofficial translation of a statement issued by the Supreme Council of the Egyptian Armed Forces on Thursday, Feb. 10:

title: A Year in the Slow Lane in a 30 Ford
description: BACKING out of the garage before work on a mild day last fall, Jonathan Klinger heard a loud backfire from his 1930 Model A Ford.

title: British Photographer Is Wounded in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A British photographer on a foot patrol with Afghan and American soldiers in southern Afghanistan was gravely wounded this week when he stepped on a makeshift bomb, military officials and his family said.
