description: TEHRAN  At annual rallies on Friday that marked the anniversary of Irans Islamic Revolution, Iranians also noted the events taking place in Cairo.

title: The Delicate Art of Adjustments
description: THINGS can get awkward when a group of strangers strip down to their spandex in a steamy, sweaty room. This is especially true in yoga class, where getting into a camel pose, for instance  thrusting your hips forward while kneeling  can feel, well, a bit porny, as Claire Dederer put it in the prologue of her memoir, Poser: My Life in Twenty-Three Yoga Poses.

title: Who Are You Calling Ugly?
description: THE Aztecs ate them. Frida Kahlo enshrined them in her art. So did Diego Rivera, who in a celebrated mural in Mexico City painted one baring its teeth at the invading Spaniards as they landed at Veracruz. Dolores Olmedo, a Mexican businesswoman and Kahlos rival for Riveras affections (and never a woman to be outdone) ditched the boring cocker spaniels she once favored in order to trump Kahlo by breeding so many of the strange native dogs called Xoloitzcuintli (SHOW-low-eats-QUEENT-lee) that she eventually assembled a mighty pack.

description: After nearly three weeks, Egyptians celebrated Friday as President Hosni Mubarak resigned and ceded control to the military. Their conversations have been edited.

Now the question being raised here and in Cairo is whether they can figure out a way to share power with a restive population that for decades has had none.

title: Man Stabs 3 to Death in Brooklyn, Police Say
description: A 23-year-old man fatally stabbed his stepfather in Brooklyn early Friday and killed his girlfriend and her mother later in the day before commandeering a passing car, stabbing the driver, stealing the car and running down a pedestrian, the police said.

title: Have Faith, Lose Weight. But First, Candy.
description: If you have ever looked in the mirror and thought, Good Lord, I need to lose weight, some very cheerful people in Forest Hills, Queens, are waiting to share the good news with you. And in Park Slope, Brooklyn, on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, and in Greenwich Village. And theyve got snacks.

title: Hackers Reveal Offers to Spy on Corporate Rivals
description: WASHINGTON  A fight between a group of pro-WikiLeaks hackers and a California-based Internet security business has opened a window onto the secretive world of private companies that offer to help corporations investigate and discredit their critics.

title: Of Love in the City, and Black History
description: ITS not for nothing that theres a heart in the I Love New York logo. With all due respect to Virginia, New York, too, is for lovers. And, just in time for Valentines Day, Ariel Sabar, who wrote an award-winning autobiography, offers up Heart of the City: Nine Stories of Love and Serendipity on the Streets of New York (Da Capo Press, $24).

title: The Southern Mathew Brady
description: To readers following the standoff at Fort Sumter, the headline, albeit tiny and on page two, in the Feb. 11, 1861, edition of the Charleston Mercury was a stunner: MAJOR ANDERSON TAKEN.

title: Using Subpoena, Clemens Asks House Panel for Documents
description: Roger Clemens has subpoenaed a House committee for documents related to a hearing it held in 2008 that led to charges that he lied to Congress.

title: A Day for Food, Like Every Other
description: The chef Daniel Boulud, 55, spends the week overseeing his food empire, which includes Daniel, Caf Boulud, Bar Boulud, and DBGB Kitchen and Bar; he lives in an apartment above Daniel on the Upper East Side. On Sunday, his only day off, he might whip up a meal for friends in the kitchen at Daniel, which is usually closed for the day, race a Ferrari or visit a museum with his daughter, Alix, 21. ALEX VADUKUL

title: Making the Text-to-Mom Connection
description: Earlier this week, I wrote about text4baby, a free service that sends text messages to pregnant women, or new mothers, to provide them with useful health tips. What struck me as most noteworthy about this program was how hundreds of different types of organizations  for-profit health care providers, nonprofit community groups, wireless carriers, government agencies, and many others  had collaborated to make it all work. Text4baby seemed to shed light on the question: How do you get a country  with all its diverse institutional strengths  to work as a team?

title: Lakers Math on Anthony Equates to Defense
description: There is a reason the Lakers are apparently unwilling to trade a young, injury-prone center for the N.B.A.s most single-minded scorer. It is called history. After 16 N.B.A. championships and 31 conference titles, the franchise of George Mikan, Wilt Chamberlain, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and Shaquille ONeal suspects that defending at the rim is a strategic imperative.

title: Chronicle of a Changing City
description: PATTYS TACO TRUCK, with its $3 tacos, $5 tortillas and $7 burritos, is getting a better reception on West 86th Street than it did on East 86th Street, said its owner, Alberto Loera. When I started here, the cops from this precinct said, Welcome to the West Side  were not going to do what they did to you over on the East Side, said Mr. Loera, 27, a Mexican immigrant who was arrested in November at his previous vending location, near Lexington Avenue. Mr. Loera was issued numerous criminal summonses after he refused to comply with officers demands that he stop selling there.

title: Phil Jacksons Soft Spot for New York
description: There are few gaps in Phil Jacksons cluttered coaching rsum. He has more N.B.A. championships than anyone and more victories than most. He won a title in the Continental Basketball Association, with the Albany Patroons. He even coached a few tours in Puerto Rico. Yet somehow, Jackson never made it back to his N.B.A. roots, back to his favorite city, back to the corner of 33rd Street and Eighth Avenue. Jackson interviewed with the Knicks three times over the last three decades but the timing was never right. In 1987, the Knicks passed up Jackson, then coaching the Patroons, to hire Rick Pitino. Jackson joined the Chicago Bulls staff. Twelve years and six championships later, Jackson  a free agent after leaving the Bulls  spoke with the Garden president Dave Checketts. The exploratory talks went nowhere and Jackson instead joined the Los Angeles Lakers. Jackson was a free agent again in 2005 when Isiah Thomas asked him to coach the Knicks. Jackson declined because he got a better offer: a return to the Lakers. Now 65, Jackson intends to retire from the N.B.A. after this season, and this time for good. The opportunity for a prodigal return has seemingly passed. But at least one authority on Jackson can still envision him joining the Knicks some day. Phil is definitely a full-circle kind of a guy, and that would bring him full circle, said Jeanie Buss, Jacksons girlfriend and a Lakers executive.

title: Vonn Quits Latest Event but Hopes to Race Sunday
description: GARMISCH-PARTENKIRCHEN, Germany  Nine days after sustaining a concussion on a training run, the American skier Lindsey Vonn withdrew Friday from the slalom portion of the super-combined at the world championships, saying she was still feeling symptoms from her injury. Vonn said, however, that she remained optimistic that she would be able to defend her world downhill title on Sunday.

title: Mayor Aimed Drunken Irish Joke at an Unusually Sober Place
description: The stately town houses wrought iron doors open onto a hushed foyer. Marble busts eye guests climbing the staircase, which leads to a grand room lined with formal oil portraits. French windows offer views of the Metropolitan Museum of Art and fur-coated women slipping into idling town cars.

title: Amid Jubilation in Little Egypt, a Dissonant Voice
description: As hundreds of jubilant Egyptian-Americans took to the streets of Astoria on Friday wearing signs proclaiming Mubarak: Leave, You Donkey! and chanting God is great! Hassan Abouelenein, an Egyptian-born limousine driver, was perhaps the loneliest man in the neighborhood, known as Little Egypt.

description: ALBANY  Membership in the State Legislature involves a variety of responsibilities, like attending hearings held by legislative committees. These can often be tedious, protracted affairs.

description: Four years ago, Rishi Bhandari and his fiance put down a deposit on Apartment 3T at 110 Livingston Street, the old Board of Education headquarters in Downtown Brooklyn, which was being converted to condominiums. The price was not exorbitant, $795,000, for a two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment.

description: In less than three weeks, Barry Bonds and his longtime trainer, Greg Anderson, will meet in federal court, expected to tell a judge the same things they have been saying throughout Bondss longstanding perjury case.

description: In an article just posted on The Timess Web site, I write about how an influx of applications to American universities from China is being received in the admissions office at Grinnell College in Iowa.

description: DETROIT  The Detroit Pistons appear to be moving closer to a sale to the private equity financier Tom Gores.

title: Soldier May Testify Against Comrades in Afghan Killings, Lawyer Says
description: SEATTLE  The cases against four of the Army soldiers accused of killing three unarmed Afghan civilians for sport last year could hinge on a fifth soldier whose lawyer said he was prepared to plead guilty to the crimes and testify against the others.

description: There are few gaps in Phil Jacksons cluttered coaching rsum. He has more N.B.A. championships than anyone and more victories than most. He won a title in the Continental Basketball Association, with the Albany Patroons. He even coached a few tours in Puerto Rico.

Parking Rules for New York City
description: Alternate-side parking regulations in New York City will be suspended on Saturday in observance of Lincolns Birthday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Malware Aimed at Iran Hit Five Sites, Report Says
description: The Stuxnet software worm repeatedly sought to infect five industrial facilities in Iran over a 10-month period, a new report says, in what could be a clue into how it might have infected the Iranian uranium enrichment complex at Natanz.

description: Even before the M.C. gushes his greetings of wilkommen and welcome, officially opening Cabaret, other actors at the John W. Engeman Theater in Northport have been busy onstage engaging the audience.

description: PISCATAWAY, N.J.  For now, Khadijah Rushdan is the point guard for the Rutgers womens basketball team, which means Coach C. Vivian Stringer needs her to play with a game face that reflects buoyancy and confidence. Rushdan said that has been a challenge.

title: Exploring Oppression, in Chile and in Love
description: ESPERANZA LEN is interested in blurring boundaries, so it is appropriate that Solar, the gallery she runs, is in the basement of her East Hampton home. With La Cueca, a two-character play to be presented at Solar this month, Ms. Len and the playwright Andrea Goldman will blur another boundary as well.

title: Saturday: Curly Rider?
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  This was kind of a schizoid solve for me, although I enjoyed it. How did you do?

title: A Haunting Piano Lesson
description: Berniece aint gonna sell that piano.

title: Arab Leaders, Facing Calls for Reform, Consider Next Move
description: BEIRUT  Across the Arab world on Friday, thousands of people poured into the streets to celebrate the resignation of President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt after nearly three weeks of demonstrations against his almost 30-year rule.

title: Birthplace of Uprising Welcomes Its Success
description: CAIRO  The news came without warning or detail at 6:05 p.m. Thousands roared their approval and hundreds ran to join them in the square. The president was gone, and Egypt seemed reborn.

title: Mubaraks Fall Prompts Double Takes by Anchors
description: It took 18 days to shake the world, but this time the revolution was shown live. People around the globe watched Egyptians rise up in an unarmed insurrection. They looked on, gobsmacked, as the Mubarak dictatorship crumbled on camera. Even the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989 didnt quite have the same hypnotic pull and roller-coaster suspense  this was a long vigil that carried a constant threat of mass violence in high definition.

title: Stars Current and Future to Play in Sunday Jazz Series
description: SINCE 1980, the PJS Jazz Society and its predecessors have built an impressive record of longevity, presenting eight monthly concerts every year at the First Presbyterian Church in Mount Vernon. The record on quality has been equally striking, as the societys members work their connections with the jazz elite to book established and emerging artists of note.

title: Perpetuating a Musical Legacy
description: WORDS generally come easily to the violinist Daniel Hope. But his comments were measured last month as he described his experience on Jan. 27 of last year, when, standing before the German chancellor, the Israeli president and the entire German Parliament on Holocaust Remembrance Day, he played Ravels Kaddish, which is based on the Jewish prayer for the dead.

title: French Provocateur Enters Battle Over Comments
description: PARIS

title: A Thousand Clowns, but Just One Oddball
description: Considering the profusion of antique shops in Red Bank, it is surprising that the Two River Theater Companys production of A Thousand Clowns there does not feature a more convincing array of junk cluttering its oddball heros messy apartment.

title: Traveling Along the Immigrants Road
description: WHEN Tim Raphael, director of the Center for Migration and the Global City at Rutgers-Newark, compares his campus to a highway  specifically, to Queens Boulevard in New York  the connection between the two things might not be immediately obvious. It is diversity.

title: Russia: Radical Art Collective Shortlisted for Ministry Prize
description: The radical art collective Voina has been shortlisted for a contemporary art award by Russias Ministry of Culture and the National Center for Contemporary Art for a project that consisted of a 210-foot penis painted on a drawbridge in St. Petersburg. The nomination came despite the fact that two of the groups leaders await trial on hooliganism charges that could bring a sentence of up to seven years  the fallout from an action they called Palace Revolution, which involved running up to parked police cars and turning them upside-down. A St. Petersburg judge refused to grant bail for the two last month, despite an offer to pay from Banksy, the mysterious British street artist. Voinas other actions have included an orgy in the State Museum of Biology and throwing live cats over a counter at McDonalds, but they drew special attention for the drawbridge painting, which slowly rose to point at the St. Petersburg headquarters of the state security service, the F.S.B. It stood for several hours before the authorities had it scrubbed off.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in Connecticut this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to the Connecticut Calendar, Metropolitan, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: Pakistan: Austerity Cabinet Begins
description: President Asif Ali Zardari swore in a new, smaller group of cabinet ministers on Friday in what the government described as part of an austerity drive to cut expenditures. Most of the 22 ministers sworn in Friday were from the presidents Pakistan Peoples Party. The previous cabinet, made up of more than 60 ministers, state ministers and advisers, resigned this week. Critics called the step window dressing and said it would not be enough to win the confidence of international donors and the International Monetary Fund, which have been urging wide-ranging reforms to shore up the faltering economy.

description: WASHINGTON  At the Treasury Department, a team of officials is trying to keep Uncle Sam a few steps ahead of the bill collectors.

description: Robert Wright of Bloggingheads.tv and Amjad Atallah, right, of the New America Foundation discuss America and Middle East democracy.

description: WASHINGTON  While every presidential aspirant who spoke at the Conservative Political Action Conference on Friday blasted President Obama for his economic program, one applause line seemed to stand out.

description: NEWARK  Ilya Kovalchuk smiled and his eyes brightened, as if he could not quite believe his sudden good fortune. In less than 24 hours, Kovalchuk, the Devils $100 million left wing, had broken another tie and won another game with another perfect shot.

title: O Oysters
description: When your next oyster arrives on the half-shell, pause to consider it. It is a remnant of a vanished ecosystem and a reminder of a time when New York was oyster city. You can almost imagine the wholesale oyster barges docked along the East River and the sight of oystermen working the waters around Staten Island in the mid-19th century. Those were mostly bedded oysters  brought in from other locations and grown to size within easy reach of New York.

description: As the throngs celebrated in Cairo, I couldnt help wondering about what is happening to democracy here in the United States. I think its on the ropes. Were in serious danger of becoming a democracy in name only.

description: I know that you have been wondering what the story of the shirtless Congressman tells us about the current state of American politics.

title: String Theory at threeASFOUR
Bryant Makes Fast Work of the Knicks
description: The pledge Kobe Bryant made recently, to send his coach out in style, cannot be fulfilled for a few more months. As a preliminary gesture, he gave Phil Jackson a memorable, enjoyable homecoming gift.

title: Archdiocese Plans to Close S.I. High School
description: One month after making a decision to close more than two dozen schools, the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York announced on Friday that it was closing another school at the end of the school year.

title: California: Benefactor for Watts Towers Steps Forward
description: The Watts Towers, an aging cultural landmark in Los Angeles that has become the subject of a major restoration effort, is receiving $500,000 from the James Irvine Foundation to help finance an evaluation of damage and small repairs. The grant was announced this week by the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, which is overseeing a project to renovate the towers. The grant is the first private donation toward care of the towers. The cost of fully repairing, stabilizing and endowing the towers has been estimated at $5 million.

title: Serenading Commuters on the Subway
description: Luis Tigre, a Mexican immigrant, and his band play norteo music on the D train between 125th Street and Fordham Road.

description: WASHINGTON  A series of potential Republican presidential contenders delivered forceful and personal condemnations of President Obama on Friday, criticizing his worldview, domestic agenda and economic proposals, while imploring fractious conservatives to unite around the goal of winning back the White House.

title: Christians Embrace a Jewish Wedding Tradition
description: In a San Antonio chapel last August, after reciting their wedding vows and exchanging their rings, Sally and Mark Austin prepared to receive communion for the first time as husband and wife. Just before they did, their minister asked them to sign a document. It was a ketubah, a traditional Jewish marriage contract.

title: Cavaliers Fall Just Short of Mark for Futility
description: CLEVELAND  The Cavaliers traded for Antawn Jamison, hoping he would one day hit a big shot, while the Quicken Loans Arena crowd roared, danced and cheered. On Friday, it happened. Jamison made his biggest one as a Cavalier, although it came late by a few months, a lot of losses and one noteworthy summer defection.

title: Unrepentance Day
description: Youve been out of public sight for four years, writing your autobiography, Known and Unknown: A Memoir. Do you miss the action? I just really loved serving in government, and Ive also loved being out of government in business and doing other things, so I looked at it and whats going on in current events and wish those folks well, but I have a distance from it.

title: Just One Look | Christian Dior Pre-Fall Collection
description: The Pre-Fall Collections, being shown in New York over the next several weeks, arrive in stores in May to fill the gap between bikinis and furs.John Gallianos muse du jour is Wallis Simpson, whose legendary love affair with Edward VIII provided the inspiration for his pre-fall collection. Tweed, tartan and argyle  cut into thigh-grazing kilts and mini dresses  rule the day looks. (Um, no wonder Edward gave up the throne for her.) And speaking of the king, or rather, The Kings Speech, some smart starlet should reserve Gallianos pale blue halter gown for the night of Feb. 27.

title: Police Headquarters Is Hit in Afghan South
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  At least four gunmen wearing vests with explosives in them attacked police headquarters in the southern city of Kandahar on Saturday, the third such attack since the start of the year in the strategically important city.

description: CAIRO  As a new era dawned in Egypt on Saturday, the army leadership sought to reassure Egyptians and the world that it would shepherd a transition to civilian rule and honor international commitments like the peace treaty with Israel.

description: The Fort Worth Star-Telegram has provided a time line of the botched preparations for the temporary seating at the Super Bowl. The Star-Telegram said the information is from e-mails and documents released Friday by the city of Arlington in response to a request under the Texas Public Information Act.

description: As magic tricks go, creating a new automotive market segment might not rank up there with sawing a lady in half, making the Statue of Liberty disappear, or escaping a padlocked milk can.

description: Im not sure the Los Angeles Lakers created the strategy of playing off of Bostons Rajon Rondo to pack the paint, but they certainly popularized it in their bouts with the Celtics in the N.B.A. Finals.

title: Urban Forager | Salt-Loving Mushrooms
description: Though winter salts effects on the city are numerous  de-iced sidewalks, salt-splotched cars, canines sporting booties or cradled in the protective arms of owners  less immediately obvious is the impact on the natural environment, including the fungi underfoot. One byproduct of road salt may be the surprise appearance of autumn Agaricus bernardii, a relative of the white button mushroom found in supermarkets, long after all the snow and ice of the previous winter has melted.

title: Algerian Riot Police Break Up Protest
description: ALGIERS  Riot police officers stifled a protest in Algerias capital on Saturday by hundreds of people voicing the same demands for change that have helped topple two of the regions autocratic governments over the last month.

title: Structural Impediment
description: Interesting and depressing interview with Charles Plosser, the Feds reigning inflation hawk. Whats striking is that he is completely committed to the view that were experiencing structural employment:

description: This interview with F. Mark Gumz, president and C.E.O. of the Olympus Corporation of the Americas, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Have You Charged Your Eyeglasses Today?
description: A NEW device may be joining smartphones, iPads and music players that you have to charge overnight: electronic eyeglasses. These glasses have tiny batteries, microchips and assorted electronics to turn reading power on when you need it and off when you dont.

description: Q. You are considering whether to start a social networking effort on behalf of your company. Can that kind of exposure be beneficial?

title: Palestinian Leaders Suddenly Call for Elections
description: JERUSALEM  The Palestinian leadership announced Saturday that it planned to hold presidential and parliamentary elections by September, apparently a response to the revolts in Tunisia and Egypt calling for greater democracy and government accountability.

title: From Rocketry to Surgery
description: WHEN I was about 5, I was always taking apart radios, clocks and other electronic devices. If our neighbors were tossing something out, they would give it to me. Id open the back of the unit and look at the vacuum tubes. I knew that if they werent glowing, they were broken and Id try and find replacements.

title: Updates on Day 1 of Egypts Transition
description: The Lede is following Egypts transition, as the countrys military takes charge and protest movements grow across the region. For a summary of the latest developments, read the current version of todays main news article from my colleagues in Cairo. Updates below mix alerts on breaking news with reports from bloggers and journalists on the ground. A stream of Twitter updates on Egypts revolution is in this blogs right column.

title: Customer Bites Retailer? Thats the Argument
description: THE idea for this weeks episode comes from Scott Wainner, the founder and chief executive of ResellerRatings, a Web site that allows consumers to rate products and retailers. Mr. Wainner wrote to the Haggler to recount the tale of a shopper who posted a negative review of a company called Full House Appliances, an online appliance seller in Washington State.

title: When Factories Vanish, So Can Innovators
description: SPOONS and forks, the metal flatware that everyone uses, are no longer made in the United States. The last factory in an industry stretching back to colonial times closed eight months ago in Sherrill, N.Y., a small community in the foothills of the Adirondacks, and 80 employees lost their jobs.

title: Imagining Life Without Fannie and Freddie
description: KUDOS to Treasury and the Department of Housing and Urban Development for some straight talk about the nations broken mortgage system.

description: PRETEND for a moment that you are Googles search engine.

description: LAST year, the health of the global recovery was very much in doubt, and many investors worried about the possibility of a double-dip recession in the United States.

description: WASHINGTON

title: Backstage Beauty | Rag & Bone
description: From the looks of their fall collection, this winter has taken a toll on Rag & Bone designers David Neville and Marcus Wainwright. Theres a lot of shearling; its Eskimo-inspired, said the makeup artist Gucci Westman backstage. Its makeup you would do if you were on a trek in Bhutan or something. Like youd use eyeliner because you heard it would keep bugs away. Unfortunately, at least for John Galliano during a damp summer, this last part is not true  but nonetheless, Westmans handiwork, all done using the products shes created with Revlon, is very pretty. Im using a purple lipstick on the bottom [lid] and then brown shadow over it, and then Im using black liner to rim the eyes. Im bringing the shadow down further than normal. The cheeks are just windswept; Im using that same purple color all over the cheeks and the lips. The hairstylist Guido Palau crafted very loose braids of varying thickness and number to go with the reference. Its very clean and natural, he said. I want it to feel hardly in there, so theres a point of reference but its not overly anythinglike when a girl starts braiding her hair by herself. Its kind of an easy one. Exactly what youd want when hiking through the Himalayas or, you know, Brooklyn.

title: Emerging Markets as Partners, Not Rivals
description: IN his State of the Union address last month, President Obama set the stage for a coming policy debate and his re-election bid with a catch phrase. Six times, he called on Americans to win the future. And he used the variant winning the future three other times. But is this really a good way to frame the economic challenges we face?

title: Estate and Gift Rules: Some Clarity, for Now
description: FOR estate planning, the big headline to emerge from the tax deal last December was that the estate tax exemption would be raised in 2011 to $5 million, or $10 million for married couples. Anything over those thresholds would be subject to a 35 percent tax.

title: Some Advice for Wary Spouses: Consider Filing a Separate Return
description: WHAT if your spouse ran a Ponzi scheme, reaping millions or billions, and you didnt know it? What if the scheme unraveled, and, along with everything else  your spouses shame, inmate number and myriad lawsuits  the Internal Revenue Service came after you for the unpaid tax on those dirty dollars?

title: Those Disappearing Tax Breaks
description: MANY taxpayers may be in for an unpleasant surprise this filing season: despite the extension of Bush-era tax rates, some of the breaks they enjoyed on their 2009 returns are not available for 2010.

title: The Push to Trim Corporate Tax Rates
description: WHEN President Obama urged in his State of the Union address that corporate taxation be simplified and rates reduced, he joined many others in Washington who have called for an overhaul of the system.

title: Health Care and Taxes: A Pause Before Impact
description: WASHINGTON

title: Fighting Words
description: At a House hearing last week, Lisa Jackson, the administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, strenuously objected to a bill introduced by three Republicans, including Represenative Fred Upton of Michigan, to thwart the agencys efforts to regulate greenhouse gas emissions.

description: TAX-PREPARATION software usually makes an onerous task easier. It doesnt make doing a tax return fun, but it does make it far less frustrating and time-consuming.

title: Hes Staying!
description: In June, Egypts president, Gamal Abdel Nasser, announced that he was resigning after Israel defeated Egypt, Syria and Jordan in the Six-Day War. Sixteen hours later, he said he would remain in view of the peoples determination to refuse my resignation. The Timess Eric Pace reported from Cairo on the reaction:

title: Bread and Protest
description: Laurie A. Garrett, a senior fellow for global health at the Council on Foreign Relations, spoke recently about the role rising wheat prices are playing in the unrest in the Middle East, particularly in Egypt, the worlds largest wheat importer. If prices skyrocket, then you get a real sense of anger and injustice. A lot of governments have dealt with this problem by creating subsidies or price controls... But eventually, very few governments can really get away with it because they just cant afford it.

title: Variety: A Fragrant Acrostic
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  We still have a day left until Valentines Day, but Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon have gotten an early start with a lovely puzzle for us today. An acrostic may not be a traditional Valentines Day gift, but lets open our minds and hearts for this one. Im sure youll find it more than worth your while.

title: Bomber Strikes Shiite Pilgrims Bus in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  A suicide bomber attacked a bus carrying Shiite pilgrims home from Samarra on Saturday, killing at least 33 people in the latest of several recent assaults on pilgrims.

title: Of Dreams and Tribes
description: Yesterday, I took the R train down to SoHo to see Rag & Bone, a thoroughly enjoyable blend of ski and Scotland (Im drastically abbreviating) that included two-tone ribbed leggings, mini kilts and snug jackets in tartan, chunky boots with many straps, and romantic fleece coats. I said hello to one or two members of the fashion tribe I had not yet seen  you see everyone eventually in your dreams  and then I went out into the cold and walked to the Prince Street station. The subway was crowded, but I found a seat and listened to some young Chinese talking. I closed my eyes as we rocked and rattled to Times Square.

title: Opposition Leader in Rwanda is Sentenced to 4 Years
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  A prominent Rwandan opposition leader, Bernard Ntaganda, who was accused of stoking ethnic tensions was sentenced on Friday night to four years in jail, Rwandan authorities said.

title: Barbour to Conservatives: G.O.P. Is United
description: A year ago, Gov. Haley Barbour of Mississippi issued a stern warning to Republicans, saying that divisions inside their party were the secret prayer of Democrats, declaring: Barack Obama has worn out three sets of knee pads, down on his knees paying that the conservative vote is split.

title: The Economics of Blogging and The Huffington Post
description: When The Huffington Post announced earlier this week that it was being acquired by AOL for $315 million in cash and stock, one group felt slighted: a set of unpaid bloggers for the site, identifying by the Twitter hashtag #huffpuff, which claims that The Huffington Post has built a blog-empire on the backs of thousands of citizen journalists.

title: Risk and Reward in Utero
description: The two mothers-to-be felt the same urgency. Told that their babies had potentially crippling spina bifida, both women hoped to receive an ambitious surgery that closes the hole in the spine while babies are in the womb.

(Drag the orange bar left to reveal the full transformation.)

title: Suspect in Brooklyn Stabbing Rampage Is Captured
description: A fugitive with a knife, who the police said had left behind a calamity of murders and broken lives in Brooklyn, was captured by officers at Times Square on Saturday morning after stabbing another victim on a subway train, investigators said.

title: Indomitable Russell Values One Accolade Above the Rest
description: Personal honors never meant much to Bill Russell, one of Americas most successful athletes, with 2 college titles, 1 Olympic gold medal and 11  count em, 11  N.B.A. championships with the Boston Celtics.

title: The Closing of the American Erotic
description: Lenny Bruce used to ask why it was obscene to show sex in American movies but not violence. Fifty years later, our screens remain washed in red, with severed if not necessarily naked body parts. More than half of the mostly American titles that received R ratings last year contained some kind of violence (as in strong, bloody and grisly bloody violence and torture) while only a third had sexual content. No NC-17 ratings were handed out, which bar youngsters, the viewers the studios most lust after.

title: Huff and Puff and Blow Your House Down
description: Under the weight of record snows, roofs across the Northeast have been buckling this winter, raining debris on children skating in ice rinks, crushing cows and tractors in farmers barns and even flattening a garage full of antique cars. In December, nearly 18 inches of new heavy snow brought down the roof of the Metrodome in Minneapolis, forcing the Vikings to temporarily relocate to Detroit.

title: Why Innovation Doffs an Old Hat
description: Just as the average human carries around the remnants of a prehistoric tail and a useless appendix, the tools we use also bear marks of the evolutionary process from which they arose.

description: In every one of Omar Minayas off-seasons as the Mets general manager, he made at least one flashy acquisition as he tried to build a championship team.

title: For Yankees New Coach, a Daunting To-Do List
description: TAMPA, Fla.  One summer night in Philadelphia in 1990, two of the Cincinnati Reds delightfully mischievous relievers decided to put a scare into Larry Rothschild, the teams first-year bullpen coach.

title: Wait Till Next Year Will Soon Be Over for Baseball Fans
description: Spring training camps open this week in Arizona and Florida, meaning 30 temporary tourist attractions are sprouting in the sunshine. So if the Ostrich Festival in Chandler, Ariz., isnt your thing, or if youre planning to skip the Strawberry Festival in Plant City, Fla., you still have plenty of options.

title: In U.S. Signals to Egypt, Obama Straddled a Rift
description: This article is by Helene Cooper, Mark Landler and David E. Sanger.

title: Inmates Death Exposes Health Care Problems in Local Jails
description: LONGVIEW  Amy Lynn Cowling was 33, she had three children, and her first grandchild was born a day after she died in an East Texas jail  slumped over her bed, clutching a bottle of Diet Dr Pepper, after a day of wailing and seizures.

title: Palin Adds Glassner as Top Political Adviser
description: As Sarah Palin decides in the coming weeks or months whether to run for president, she will rely on the counsel of a newly hired chief of staff with a long history in Republican campaigns, who is coming aboard to bring order to her sprawling political operation.

description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#306", 592, 440, true, chameleonData);

title: Tight Race to Finish at Pebble Beach
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif.  Steve Marino clung tenuously to the lead after three rounds of the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am on Saturday, staying atop a leader board filled with challengers who are, like him, still seeking their first victory. Of the top 10 players on the board, seven have yet to win a tournament.

title: Georgians Build Ties With Russian Caucasus
description: TBILISI, Georgia  At 6 p.m. on a recent Tuesday, a satellite news channel financed by the Georgian government went on the air with a palpable air of excitement. Unlike Georgias other channels, First Caucasus News was broadcasting in Russian  its target audience includes viewers north of its border, in the mountainous and restive Russian region known as the North Caucasus.

title: Obamas Budget Seeks Deep Cuts in Domestic Spending
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, who is proposing his third annual budget on Monday, will say that it can reduce projected deficits by $1.1 trillion over the next decade, enough to stabilize the nations fiscal health and buy time to address its longer-term problems, according to a senior administration official.

title: How the War of Words Was Won in Cairo
description: How do you tell a dictator to get lost?

title: Cairos Protest Signs Address a Despot, and the World
description: Employing Internet jargon and foreign languages, protesters aimed their messages at an international audience.

title: A Diploma, Then the Draft
description: STANFORD, Calif.  As he pedaled through campus on a sunny morning last week, Stanford quarterback Andrew Luck explained the two clear plastic bags covering his bike seat. At a cradle of technological ingenuity, Luck had found a low-tech solution for shielding his posterior from the morning dew.

title: At Prabal Gurung, a Return to Glamour
description: Linda Fargo, the fashion director of Bergdorf Goodman, was coming out of the backstage area of Prabal Gurungs show just as I was going in. I think both of us were a little surprised at the shift seen on Mr. Gurungs runway, from his clean and bright sportswear last season to full-on evening glamour for fall, with louche-ly draped dresses in vampy red and pink, feathers from top to bottom on some looks, lace prints that seemed to disintegrate on others and stockings with a pattern that suggested corset ribbons.

title: Israeli Archive and Google Team Up to Put Holocaust Stories at Fingertips
description: TEL AVIV  When Google, the worlds largest search engine, joined forces with Yad Vashem, keeper of the worlds largest Holocaust archive, the first thing one Google employee here did was search for his grandfathers name.

title: Myanmar Arrests a Newspaper Editor
description: BANGKOK  The Australian editor of an English-language newspaper that publishes in Myanmar has been arrested and jailed in what an associate said Saturday was part of a business dispute.

title: For Groups That Sell Goods Abroad, Help From U.S. Taxpayers
description: WASHINGTON  In India, one of the most-talked-about television programs is the reality show Lets Design.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Mens Fall Fashion 2011 | N. Hoolywood
description: A terrific show from Daisuke Obana at N. Hoolywood paid an elegaic homage to Ansel Adams photographs of Yosemite and the intrepid mountaineers who scaled the famed Half Dome. The hirsute and hearty models, looking sun ravaged, carried ropes, picks, and oversized packs down the runway in the elegant Park Avenue Armory thatserving as an ersatz explorers club. This mustard yellow chunky cable knit sweater, matching gaiters and cap worn with a blown out plaid coat and knickers was tops.

title: The Return of Pushing Democracy
description: WASHINGTON  The cheers of Tahrir Square were heard around the world. But if you listened carefully, you might have heard cheering from another quarter 7,000 miles from Cairo as well, in Dallas.

title: Missing Micrograms Set a Standard on Edge
description: SVRES, France  No one knows exactly why the international prototype of the kilogram, as pampered a hunk of platinum and iridium as ever existed, appears to weigh less than it did when it was manufactured in the late 19th century.

title: Game, Like the Name, May Soon Ring a Bell
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif.  Another bright new face is making an appearance on the PGA Tour this weekend at the Pebble Beach AT&T National Pro-Am, a tournament that has plenty of space for rookies in the tournament field but not usually on the leader board.

title: Hapless but Not Quite Hopeless
description: CLEVELAND  Jay Kelley bought into a season-ticket package for the Cleveland Cavaliers nearly a decade ago. He kept his fingers crossed that everything would fall into place for a star-crossed franchise. His commitment paid dividends when the Cavaliers drafted LeBron James, the local phenom, who restored the franchise to relevancy.

description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#150", 592, 440, true, chameleonData);

title: The Negro Leagues Discovered an Oasis at Yankee Stadium
description: On July 5, 1930, about 20,000 fans filed into seven-year-old Yankee Stadium for a baseball doubleheader. What made this day special was that the teams, the New York Lincoln Giants and the Baltimore Black Sox, were the first Negro leagues clubs to play at the Stadium, which was essentially for whites only, like so many other public places in the United States at the time.

title: Failure to Launch
description: Update: Arithmetic error corrected; its not quite as striking as I originally posted, because not as many had full time jobs even in 2007 as I originally stated, but the decline is still terrible.

title: Powerful Left Hook, Only Now Its on the Golf Course
description: Gerry Cooneys left hook helped him compile a 28-3 record with 21 knockouts. George Foreman and Larry Holmes said it was the most powerful punch they had ever felt.

title: Model-Morphosis | Constance Jablonski at Prabal Gurung
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of New York Fashion Week. Here, the model Constance Jablonski before (left) and after (right) transforms, with makeup by Tom Pecheux for M.A.C. and hair by Didier Malige for Frederick Fekkai. (Drag the orange bar left to reveal the full transformation.)

title: The Ghost of Revolutions Past
description: Paris

title: Mubarak Family Riches Attract New Focus
description: After Hosni Mubaraks younger son, Gamal, left his job as an executive with Bank of America in London in the mid-1990s, he joined forces with Egypts largest investment bank. Today he has a significant stake in a private equity company with interests throughout the Egyptian economy, from oil to agriculture to tourism, corporate records and interviews show.

title: Rich in Land, Aborigines Split on How to Use It
description: BROOME, Australia  Australia is experiencing a natural resources boom, driven by Chinas headlong modernization, that is often described as a once-in-a-century phenomenon. It has minted billionaires out of businessmen who deal in iron ore and coal, and it has enriched many Australians by increasing the value of their homes and creating well-paying jobs.

title: Ohio State, the Last Undefeated Contender, Tumbles at Wisconsin
description: MADISON, Wis.  As the student section charged onto the court Saturday and the final undefeated team in college basketball left with its first loss, Wisconsins 71-67 upset of Ohio State raised an age-old question.

title: Chinas Railway Minister Loses Post in Corruption Inquiry
description: BEIJING  The railway minister of China, Liu Zhijun, has been removed from the top post in the ministry because he is being investigated for corruption, according to a report on Saturday by Xinhua, the state news agency. Mr. Liu is the most senior Chinese official to come under such investigation in years.

title: At Last, Bernie Madoff Gives Back
description: WHEN Bernie Madoff was arrested in December 2008, America feasted vicariously on a cautionary tale of greed run amok. But like Rod Blagojevich, the stunt governor of Illinois who had been arrested days earlier, Madoff was something of a sideshow to that dark months main events. For a nation reeling from an often incomprehensible economic tsunami and unable to identify the culprits, he was, for the moment, the right made-to-order villain at the right time.

title: Coveting N.H.L. Club, Quebec Builds From the Ground Up
description: Rgis Labeaume, the mayor of Quebec City, rolled the dice last week in his effort to attract an N.H.L. club, announcing plans to build a $400 million arena financed entirely by the municipal and provincial governments.

title: Trying to Hold Down Blue Language on a Red-Letter Day
description: CITRONELLE, Ala.  Its shaping up to be a darn nice Valentines Day here in Mobile County.

title: After Badgers Victory, a Packer Salutes Ryan
description: In Wisconsin, winners apparently appreciate other winners. After No. 13 Wisconsin beat No. 1 Ohio State, 71-67, on Saturday and ended the Buckeyes run at an undefeated season, Badgers Coach Bo Ryan was the subject of a laudatory Twitter message from Green Bay quarterback, and Super Bowl M.V.P., Aaron Rodgers that called him the best coach in college basketball. Not a bad day for Ryan: his team beats the No. 1 team in the country and he gets a major compliment from the states No. 1 folk hero. (Hat tip to Quickish for the Rodgers Twitter message.)

title: To Defend the Accused in a Tucson Rampage, First a Battle to Get Inside a Mind
description: TUCSON  Judy Clarke, the public defender for the man charged in the Tucson shooting, Jared L. Loughner, has made motions on his behalf and entered a plea for him of not guilty. But one of her most essential acts of lawyering came when she patted Mr. Loughner on the back in court last month, leaned in close and whispered in his ear.

title: What Egypt Can Teach America
description: Its a new day in the Arab world  and, lets hope, in American relations to the Arab world.

title: Prabal Does Cocktail Couture
description: Keeping in mind dozens of fashion week parties can, well, start to blur, the designer Prabal Gurung has come up with a sort of forget-me-not for his after-party, which is being held tonight at Mr. H in the Mondrian Hotel. Detail-obsessed Prabal has teamed up with Sally Hansen and Belvedere Vodka to create a nail lacquer line and cocktail list, that match his own collection. A way to continuously serve up his modern take on Victorian-era style (he describes his fall collection as Miss Havisham meets John Singer Sargents Parisian Beggar Girl), Crinoline is your classic Greyhound, and a White Cosmopolitan masquerades as Dorian Grey. Each drink has a coordinating nail shade available at Sally Hansen. Or, follow the recipes below to keep your fashion-week buzz going.

title: Administration to Push for Small Modular Reactors
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administrations 2012 budget proposal will include a request for money to help develop small modular reactors that would be owned by a utility and would supply electricity to a government lab, people involved in the effort say.

title: They Did It
description: CAIRO

title: Arthur Schatzkin, Who Studied High-Fiber Diet and Polyps, Dies at 62
description: Dr. Arthur Schatzkin, an epidemiologist whose investigations into the connections between diet and cancer yielded new analytic tools and led to the discovery that eating fiber did not prevent the recurrence of polyps in the colon, died on Jan. 20 in Chevy Chase, Md. He was 62.

title: Conservatives Straw Poll Shows Unsettled Republican Field
description: 6:50 p.m. | Updated WASHINGTON  With the Republican presidential campaign poised to open, conservative activists signaled on Saturday that they were remarkably unsettled over who should win the partys nomination, creating a wide-open race over the next year for the right to challenge President Obama.

title: Service Couldnt Be Better, and at $200 a Ton It Should Be
description: The 600,000 households in Chicago that rely on City Hall to collect and dispose of their trash enjoy first-rate service. Regardless of what residents leave in alleys, the city carts it away to a landfill at no extra charge.

title: Simply the Worst
description: WASHINGTON

title: Sunday: Home Under the Midnight Sun
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Did this seem like a tougher than usual Sunday to you? The puzzle, I mean. Not your day, which I hope is just peachy. I had a sprinkling of entries that I was able to salt into the grid at first, but it took me awhile to really get a toehold.

title: A Patriot Act Surprise
description: Republicans have a long history of favoring small government except when it comes to surveillance and security, at which point civil liberties take a back seat. Last week, however, 26 Republicans in the House demonstrated a remarkable consistency by joining 122 Democrats to prevent the extension of three questionable provisions of the Patriot Act, the post-9/11 law created during the Bush administration.

title: It May Make Them Think Twice
description: Financial regulators certainly took their time, but proposed new rules to curb bankers bonuses are a welcome step toward changing a compensation culture that encouraged irresponsible risk-taking and helped set off the financial crisis.

title: Convenient Amnesia
description: House Republicans are vigorously denouncing the Environmental Protection Agency as a rogue agency engaged in a borderline-illegal effort to regulate greenhouse gases. If anyone believes this to be a principled position, it is useful to recall that under President George W. Bush, the E.P.A. argued for very similar policies, based on the same reading of its responsibilities.

title: The Mob at the Feeders
description: Most days I see a male cardinal in the hickory tree behind the house, waiting to forage beneath the bird feeders. You dont really see a male cardinal. The world collapses to a carmine point that puts everything else out of focus  the hickory, the snow, the woodsmoke from the village. For its character, modest and cautious, the cardinal is overdressed. But then what would living up to that plumage mean?

description: Two military veterans succumbed to medicines meant to combat the psychological effects of war.

description: A Japanese man, a white woman, an Irish Catholic network executive  common descriptors, perhaps, in everyday talk. But put identifiers like these in a newspaper story and you are playing with fire.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Feb. 13
description: The political transition in Egypt reigns on the Sunday talk shows, two days after Hosni Mubarak ceded power to the military. And the emerging budget battle begins to take shape as the White House budget director and House Republicans preview their competing proposals.

title: 2 Safety Violations for Spider-Man
description: The New York State Department of Labor has issued two safety violations against the Broadway musical Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark over accidents last year that involved an actor falling more than 20 feet during the show and two other performers sustaining injuries while rehearsing a sling-shot technique, a state official familiar with the violations said Saturday.

title: Egypts Path After Uprising Does Not Have to Follow Irans
description: CAIRO  Two Egyptian leaders have been struck down in 30 years: one by an Islamist assassins bullets, the other by the demands of hundreds of thousands of protesters in a peaceful uprising. The first event, the death of President Anwar el-Sadat, marked a spectacle of the most militant brand of political Islam. The revolution the world witnessed Friday, the toppling of President Hosni Mubarak, may herald the dawn of something else.

title: 18 Days at the Center of Egypts Revolution
description: Tahrir Square, in downtown Cairo, was the epicenter of antigovernment protests that led to the ouster of President Hosni Mubarak.

title: At Gathering, Ron Paul Is No. 1 for 2012
description: WASHINGTON  With the Republican presidential campaign poised to open, conservative activists signaled on Saturday that they were unsettled over who should win the partys nomination, indicating a wide-open race for the right to challenge President Obama.

title: To Cut or Not to Cut: That Is the Budget Question
description: To the Editor:

title: In Path of Suspected Brooklyn Killer, an Electronic Trail
description: The Brooklyn man who police said left a trail of violence and death across the city on Friday and Saturday also left a trail, of sorts, on a pager service that notifies news media members of breaking news in New York.

title: Care for Public Spaces
description: To the Editor:

title: Scorecard | Jason Wu Wins!
description: Minimalism is so last season. On day two of New York fashion week, designers cut through the shades of greige. Apologies to the queen of draping, but Scorecard knows Jason Wu proved its possible to get ineffably clean lines and to embellish with a spot of lace  or 15.

title: No Argument: Thomas Keeps 5-Year Silence
description: WASHINGTON  The anniversary will probably be observed in silence.

title: Pressures Build to Slash Costs of City Employees
description: Shortly after the November elections, an unusual band of labor leaders, along with Ben Rosenfield, the city controller, and Sean Elsbernd, the most fiscally conservative city supervisor, met in the posh offices of Warren Hellman, a San Francisco investor and philanthropist, with one goal in mind: Cutting a deal to slash the ballooning public employee costs weighing heavily on the citys financial crisis.

title: Pacific Herring Are Back in the Bay in Big Numbers, Three Years After a Major Oil Spill
description: The herring that have recently flooded into San Francisco Bay in dense schools have surprised fishermen and ecologists, who doubted that the generation of the silvery fish that was spawned during a devastating oil spill three years ago would survive.

title: Keeping Twitter Here Presents a Rare Chance
description: Jonathan Weber writes a column for The Bay Citizen.

title: The Next Egypt
description: My Sunday column attempts to offer four lessons from our failures in the Middle East, Egypt included. My thought is we should get into position to do better for the next Egypt.

title: Giant Sundial: Ingleside Terraces
description: At the end of a quiet cul-de-sac in San Franciscos Ingleside neighborhood is an enormous sundial. It was installed almost a century ago as the centerpiece of a real estate development and adorns a small park. HANK PELLISSIER

title: Scenes From the Conservative Political Action Conference
description: This years conference underscored the fluidity of the Republican field of candidates in the 2012 presidential election, and a dozen potential contenders addressed the group and tried to sum up their chances.

title: Miriam Hansen, a Scholar of Cinema, Dies at 61
description: Miriam Hansen, a scholar of cinema who studied not only film itself but also the early 20th-century creation known as the film audience, died on Feb. 5 in Chicago. She was 61 and a Chicago resident.

title: Lucky for Cutler, Chicago Can Be Forgiving
description: Dan McGrath writes a column for the Chicago News Cooperative.

title: What Lincoln Meant to the Slaves
description: The enormous excitement and anticipation of the 1860 presidential election campaign spread into unexpected corners of the United States. Indeed, during the months surrounding the contest, and especially after Americans learned of Abraham Lincolns victory, reports circulated across the Southern states of political attentiveness and restlessness among the slaves.

title: Mayoral Forum Entertains, but Wasnt Quite a Night at the Circus
description: James Warren writes a column for the Chicago News Cooperative.

title: 41st Ward Race Attracts a Field of Diversity
description: With nine open races, the City Council is expected to have a large turnover in the Feb. 22 municipal election. One of those races includes 11 candidates trying to replace the Councils lone Republican, Alderman Brian G. Doherty, in the 41st Ward on the far Northwest Side.

title: A New Venue Expands the Possibilities for Austin City Limits
description: Most days, the staff members of the Austin Convention & Visitors Bureau hear a variation on the same two queries from tourists who are curious about Austin City Limits, the longest-running music series in American television history: Is it really shot outside? (No, its taped indoors on a soundstage.) And how can we get tickets? (You cant, most likely.)

title: Perry Fights to Cut Strings Doggett Put on School Money
description: The latest chapter in the feud between Gov. Rick Perry and Representative Lloyd Doggett over $830 million in federal money for education unfolded Tuesday, when, in his State of the State address, the governor called out a certain Texas congressman for singling out Texas for punishment in pursuit of his own agenda.

title: With Stoudemire Out, Knicks Fashion a Win
description: NEWARK  From the moment he pulled on a blue cap, beamed and proclaimed a Knicks rebirth last July, Amare Stoudemire has been a constant, an immovable force and a reliable presence. He has defined every game, every practice and every conversation.

title: One Coach, Many Young Champions
description: In the last five years, two Americans have won world youth championships: Daniel Naroditsky, who took the under-12 title in 2007, and Steven Zierk, the under-18 champion last year.

title: How Hockey Makes Headlines in Nashville
description: When Ottawa traded the popular center Mike Fisher to Nashville for draft picks Thursday, the Senators created salary-cap space and a chance to start rebuilding from an awful season. The Predators, in the thick of the tight Western Conference race, received a playoff-tested, energetic performer.

title: Altuzarra: Street Value
description: In his last fall collection, Joseph Altuzarra showed black wool suits trimmed out in glossy black goat hair and dresses with lacing. At once sensual and tough, the clothes made a statement. Retailers were impressed with Mr. Altuzarras sophistication. But there is another aspect of his talent that has shown itself before: a desire to be a little less constructed and formal. On Saturday night, at Milk Studios, Mr. Altuzarra played with that style for his loosest, most commercial collection to date. It wasnt his most exciting, but it may relate easily to how young women like to dress. And it may supply Mr. Altuzarra with working capital for future collections.

title: Assessing Sloan: Call Him Coach
description: Phil Miller covered the Utah Jazz for The Salt Lake Tribune from 2002 to 2007.

title: New York Fashion Week | Meet Kevork Kiledjian
description: Kevork Kiledjian, the Paris-born designer who founded the Guilty Brotherhood line, recently moved to New York to start a new namesake womens wear label from his Crosby Street atelier. The obvious question, especially if you are a booster of French fashion, is why leave the putative fashion capital of the world for New York? How many new designers can you name that have come from Paris in the past five years? asked Kiledjian when I caught up with him as he was putting the finishing touches on his debut collection, which will be shown on Monday at 6 p.m. at Milk Studios.

title: A Photographic Pioneer Explored in Amsterdam
description: Can manipulated reality truthfully capture real life? Amsterdams photography museum, Foam (Keizersgracht 609; 31-20-551-6500; www.foam.nl), explores the question in More Real Than Reality, an engrossing retrospective of the great American photographer W. Eugene Smith, through March 16.

title: What Next in Cairo?
description: With their principal demand met, demonstrators have differing opinions about what to do next and whether they should leave Tahrir Square in Cairo.

title: New York Fashion Week Tweets | Sunday
description: Today from 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m., we will be going backstage at Preen by Thornton Bregazzi, to give you a behind-the-scenes look at the busiest and most exhilarating moments before the show.

title: Quick Help for the Rent vs. Buy Decision
description: Trying to figure out whether you should rent a home or buy one?

title: Europe Turns on Its Axel
description: I have to say that Axel Weber has bowed out of the race for ECB head  gracefully; but this isnt really about the person, its about the views. And I am therefore glad to hear both that he wont be taking the job, and that the reason he bowed out was that euro-area leaders didnt share his hard-money views. Tightening in Europe in the face of continuing very high unemployment and low core inflation is a very bad idea.

title: Model-Morphosis | Patricia van der Vliet at BCBG Max Azria
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of New York Fashion Week. Here, the model Patricia van der Vliet at New York Models before (left) and after (right) transforms, with makeup by Charlotte Willer and hair by Neil Moodie. (Drag the orange bar left to reveal the full transformation.)

title: Egyptian Military Dissolves Parliament
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian military consolidated its control on Sunday over what it has called a democratic transition from nearly three decades of President Hosni Mubaraks authoritarian rule, dissolving the feeble Parliament, suspending the Constitution and calling for elections in six months in sweeping steps that echoed protesters demands.

title: Backstage Grooming | Richard Chai
description: For his fall mens collection, the designer Richard Chai homed in on individuality, and the striking relationship between unconventional beauties in refined clothes. The hair stylist Kevin Ryan agreed backstage, explaining that these men are not perfect, these are real men with flaws. To create a disheveled, slept-in feel, Ryan first liberally applied Bumble & Bumble Surf Spray and Sumo Tech to create a matte, dry texture, then used his own R Session Tool Root Control, a ceramic heated comb, ideal for taming frizz and flyaway strands. And since the overall goal was to make hair look rough and not too groomed, styles were finished with spritzes of TIGI Rockaholic Dirty Secret Dry Conditioner. For mysterious, sultry eyes, the makeup artist James Kaliardos used M.A.C. Satin Taupe and Charcoal Brown eye shadows and M.A.C. Brush #213, which created a smoky eye without looking like sharp eyeliner. Kaliardos then pressed M.A.C.s Brit Wit Creme Blush into models lips and cheeks, and patted M.A.C. Line Filler all over the face to minimize pores and even out complexion. Forgoing foundation altogether, Kaliardos used concealer minimally, to veil the skin and not disguise individual imperfections.

title: On S.N.L., a Law Firm With a Spider-Man Specialty
description: Just when things couldnt get any tougher for Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark on a weekend when that musical was slapped with two safety violations by the New York State Department of Labor, Broadways favorite $65 million punch line was once again skewered by Saturday Night Live. Saturdays S.N.L. included the above fake commercial for a law firm that specializes in winning settlements for audience members who have been injured by the show (including a certain Irish rock star whos sustained irreparable damage to his reputation). That firms name? Gublin and Green, of course.

title: Photos of the Moment | Billy Reid
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#22", 592, 490, true, chameleonData);

title: Victoria Beckham Deconstructed
description: Victoria Beckham, right after her show, said she likes to surprise people, which is why, after six seasons of showing variations of her signature skintight and corseted dresses, she decided to loosen things up, even more than she did last season. Well, for that reason, and because she is pregnant, she confessed.

title: A Measure of Normalcy Returns to Cairo
description: Egypts military started taking down the makeshift tents of protesters who camped out in Tahrir Square in an effort to allow traffic and normal life to return to central Cairo.

title: Unlucky in Love: Readers Tell of Romance Gone Wrong
description: Apparently, an awful lot of things can go wrong on Valentines Day. Last week, we asked you to reach into the darkest cranny of the heart-shaped box where you store your memories of romantic torment, and share a tainted bonbon or two with us. Many of you did. Here they are.

title: Backstage Beauty | Altuzarra
description: It was kind of Kate Moss in her Johnny Depp days meets Oasis meets couture, to take the collection from a rock-n-roll feel to more of a womanly look, explained the hairstylist Tina Outen of the directive that inspired the amorphous hair at Altuzarra. She was filling in on sound byte duty for Paul Hanlon, the shows key hairstylist, who was busy presiding over the swarm of stylists  three per girl  busy scraping hair back from the face, dousing it in product (chief among them Frederic Fekkai Coiff Bouffant Lifting & Texturizing Spray Gel), clipping it into twists and coils, and setting with a blow-dryer. When the clips come out, theyre going to start to destroy [the shapes] by pulling out pieces to make it more 3-D, said Outen. When [the models] are in the line, Pauls going to do his magic. In between, the makeup artist Tom Pecheux painted on a glamorous take on the 90s Kate Moss cat-eye. I was like, what is a young designer like? Who does he want to dress? And which kind of woman wants to wear a cool young designer? A rock chick, said Pecheux. His take replaced that rock chick staple, black liquid liner, with M.A.C. Rich Purple Chromagraphic Pencil on the eyes waterline and M.A.C. Keep It Cool Eye Shadow (available fall 2011), used to a soft liner effect, brushed out to the brows. I went for silver on the inner corner of the eye, almost like a futuristic tear. And the crimson lip? Its a huge controversy! Because that lip color is so ladylike, so bourgeois, said Pecheux with a laugh. But I was like, why not break the rules? A rock chick is a rock chick.

title: Yemeni Youth Square Off With Forces
description: SANA, Yemen  Young protesters in Yemen squared off against security forces on Sunday, and some marched on the presidential palace here, witnesses said, as a third day of demonstrations sought to emulate the revolution in Egypt.

title: Clive Davis Still Draws Stars at Pre-Grammy Mixer
description: LOS ANGELES  To the general public, the Grammy Awards are three and a half hours of television in which about nine awards are quickly handed out between starry performance segments. But for the music industry, the ceremony  to be held on Sunday night at the Staples Center  is the culmination of a weeklong schmoozefest of private parties, daytime conferences and breakfast meetings in different hotel restaurants.

title: Postcard From Cairo, Part 2
description: CAIRO

title: As Egypt Calms Down, So Do Israeli Nerves
description: JERUSALEM  As Israelis began to adjust to the departure of President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt, their staunchest and longest-standing regional ally, the alarm and anxiety that Israel has been projecting seemed to give way on Sunday to more nuanced tones, as well as some hints of admiration for the Egyptian people and sympathy for their cause.

title: Russian Village Is Angry, but Not With Bomber
description: ALI-YURT, Russia  Residents of this run-down little settlement in the Caucasus Mountains, in the south of Russia, speak only kindly about the Yevloyevs, a tightknit family of six who lived in a one-story, red-brick home at the edge of the village.

title: Some Amazing Grace from Derek Lam
description: Sunday morning, coffee and a sparkling Derek Lam show: not a bad start to the day. Invoking George Balanchines practical wisdom (There are no new steps, only new combinations), Mr. Lam showed classic sportswear shapes and fabrics in fresh ways. The show was a pleasure to watch. He had a variety of jackets: a smoky-blue wool peacoat, a trim bomber that combined ebony beaver and black nylon. And he paired them with sharp-looking trousers with a wide stripe down the side or, say, a pencil skirt in a nubby black-white-wine tweed.

title: Thakoon Casting
description: NYTD.fullScreenSlideShowFactory.createSlideshow("#907", 592, 400, true, chameleonData);

title: On TV, Monday Morning Quarterbacks Take On Egypt
description: Two days after Hosni Mubarak stepped down as president of Egypt, the morning talk shows on Sunday television filled with political posturing and diplomatic words of reassurance about what lies ahead for the region and the United States.

title: After Concussion, Vonn Takes Second
description: GARMISCH-PARTENKIRCHEN, Germany  It had been nearly two years since someone other than Germanys Maria Riesch or Lindsey Vonn had won a womens World Cup-caliber downhill race.

title: Mens Fall Fashion 2011 | Patrik Ervell
description: Patrik Ervells precise aesthetic and consistent references to technical fabrics made a perfect foundation for this tight, dramatic show. In his runway set, as in his clothing, he makes the most efficient and effective use of the seemingly simple: overlapping opaque nylon parachutes furled in the wind provided by a series of fans. There was a stark uniformity to the clothing, both cohesively and militaristically. A navy cotton twill jumpsuit covered in zippered pockets and topped by a bomber style jacket was my favorite of the flyboy styles.

title: Backstage Beauty | Derek Lam
description: Derek Lams last few collections have been tailored and somewhat minimalist, the type of clothing that often gets paired with a nearly nude face and natural waves on the runway. But Lam hasnt shied away from making beauty statements: most recently, the electric coral eyeliner and 60s waves for spring 2011 created by the hairstylist Orlando Pita and the makeup artist Tom Pecheux, both of whom were on hand early on this Sunday morning to work that magic again. The collection today is inspired by uniforms, so I did this school-girl uniform hairstyle, where the girl scrapes her hair back and puts a barrette in her hair, explained Pita. But were not doing the barrette, to keep it a bit more streamlined. The hair was straightened with a T3 iron, pulled into a clean half-ponytail and set with T3 Control Hairspray. Pecheux created a slate gray smoky eye using silver and black Estee Lauder shadows (available this fall), which he paired with a nude matte lipstick, brow pencil, and Este Lauder Bronze Goddess Soft Duo Bronzer. Derek Lams clothes are very feminine and very luxurious, but very graphic and minimal at the same time, said Pecheux, a sentiment that was echoed by the manicure Jin Soon Choi paired it with. Its a wintery white from Este Lauder called Porcelain  very clean, minimalistic, bright white, she said. White nail polish works on short to medium length nails, and I did a round shape  Ive done it at a lot of shows, its more feminine.

title: Preen: The Remix
description: The sweeping appearance of remixed fabrics has been an early trend of the fall collections, where youre as liable to find a cloth coat with fur sleeves as a dress made out of four kinds of tweed. What I liked about Preens fall collection was that the designers Justin Thornton and Thea Bregazzi combined fabrics in a way I havent seen anyplace else. Plus the show was darn good.

title: Tunisians Turn to Everyday Matters
description: TUNIS  Bakers have threatened to stop making baguettes unless their salaries are increased. Lawyers demanding judicial independence protested outside the Justice Ministry. Unemployed miners slept in the halls of the headquarters of a phosphate mining company, demanding more jobs.

title: N.Y.S.E. Name Must Come First in Exchange Merger, Schumer Says
description: Senator Charles E. Schumer signaled on Sunday that he might support a merger of NYSE Euronext and Deutsche Brse  so long as the New York Stock Exchanges name comes first in the combined company.

title: Suno: A New Formality
description: Suno, the label founded by Max Osterweis and designed with Erin Beatty, continues to expand its range of prints and knits, with long lines and somber colors giving the fall collection an almost formal cast. There are tunics, woven vests, fluid coats and layers in which the same print is repeated at a different scale. Wool caps come with extra-long earflaps.

title: Lemieux Reacts Strongly to Penguins-Islanders Brawl
description: The Penguins owner Mario Lemieux reacted strongly Sunday to what he called the N.H.L.s failed disciplinary measures in the aftermath of the Friday night brawl involving his team and the Islanders, in which 15 fighting majors and 346 penalty minutes were assessed.

title: Spotlight | Greg Lauren
description: If you go to the third floor of Barneys mens wear building today, youll wonder if youve wandered into an artists studio by mistake. Jackets and scarves in black, khaki and white hang like drying pieces of canvas from suspended bars while worn-out leather shoes and containers of paint litter the worktable. Welcome to Greg Laurens world.

title: Poncho Twins
description: Alexander Wang and Joseph Altuzarra are good friends, so when each showed a poncho in roughly the same style, with a quilted lining, you figured it could not have been a coincidence. Was it a poncho design challenge? And who won?

title: Yanks Abroad: A Little Traveling Music
description: Last months European transfer period made headlines with the pricey relocations of Fernando Torres (Liverpool to Chelsea; $79.5 million), Edin Dzeko (Wolfsburg to Manchester City; $42 million) and others, but dozens of lesser-known players changed clubs, too. In fact, quite a few American players were purchased or loaned in the last few weeks. Here is a quick look at how some of these Yanks are settling in at their new clubs.

title: Italians Protest Over Berlusconi Scandals
description: ROME  With signs reading Enough! and We want a country that respects women, thousands took to the streets across Italy on Sunday in coordinated demonstrations against Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi, but their outpouring of frustration did not look poised to bring about political change.

title: With Humor and Determination, Egypt Adjusts Anew
description: On Sunday, Egypts new military-led government announced it had met protester demands and dissolved the parliament and suspended the countrys constitution.

title: Whos Unemployed?
description: Larry Mishel emails me to second my concern about Charles Plossers blithe assertion that unemployment is about shifting workers out of construction. As Larry points out, the BLS provides data on the previous employment of the unemployed. There were 7.7 million more unemployed workers in 2010 than there were in 2007; of those extra 7.7 million, only 1.1 million had previously been employed in construction.

title: Race, Sex and the Trials of a Young Explorer
description: In 1859, Paul Du Chaillu, a young explorer of French origin and adopted American nationality, wandered out of the jungle after a four-year expedition in Gabon. He brought with him complete specimens of 20 gorillas, an animal almost unknown outside West Africa. The gorillas resemblance to humans astonished many people, especially after Darwin published On the Origin of Species later that year. The politician Edwin M. Stanton was soon calling Abraham Lincoln the original gorilla and joking that Du Chaillu was a fool to have gone to Africa for what he could as easily have found in Springfield, Ill.But the more common way to deal with our resemblance to monkeys and apes then was to fob it off onto other ethnic groups  typically black people, or sometimes the Irish. A few white scientists even purported to find physiological evidence, in the configuration of the skull, for classifying other races as separate species, not quite as far removed as Caucasians from our primate cousins. This undercurrent of scientific racism would play out to devastating effect in Du Chaillus own life.

It could have been a reference to her coterie of pals from broadcast news who were at the show, including Diane Sawyer and Barbara Walters, or perhaps a different sort on the other side of her horseshoe-shaped runway, like Fergie, or perhaps to herself.
